details.notes: Lovely little jump, great sunset views. Low tide only, landing on obvious beach to jumper's left. Walk back along the rocks to the car park.
details.access: Park in Trevallas Cove carpark (super narrow road in) and walk just a few minutes up the coast path. Exit is almost on the coast path.
details.anchor: Bring a stake and short rope

details.notes: Super quick turnaround, big beach landing. There's an old trail that leads back up to the carpark that goes directly beneath the exit.
details.access: Take the narrow turn off in Porthtowan and you can actually drive almost to the exit and park at the top of the cliff (if you can get a space).
details.anchor: Bring a stake and short rope

details.notes: Nice jump that becomes more enclosed further down the cliff. Onheadings preferable. Low tide only. Path out is on the steep slope on the other side of the beach. Not so obvious from above, but more obvious from below. The path isn't as steep as it looks.
details.access: Park here: 50.280944, -5.249988 and follow the coastpath to the exit. Apprx 30min walk to the Sally's Bottom area where there's several distinct exits.
details.anchor: Bring a stake and short rope

details.notes: There's a bit of a steep slope to get to this exit, worth abseiling a little. Nice jump over a bowl in the cliff, right above the beach so easy beach landing. Low tide only. Path out is on the steep slope on the other side of the beach. Not so obvious from above, but more obvious from below. The path isn't as steep as it looks.
details.access: Park here: 50.280944, -5.249988 and follow the coastpath to the exit. Apprx 30min walk to the Sally's Bottom area where there's several distinct exits.
details.anchor: Bring a stake and short rope

details.notes: Low tide only. Cool area with a few jumps. This is a super nice exit on a long narrow diving board chunck of rock and the only jump in the area so far without a beach landing. There's a narrow strip of flat rock without boulders on jumpers right (at the time of writing), this is the landing, you probably wouldn't want to miss it. GPS of the landing: 50.275409, -5.263786. Path out is on the steep slope on the other side of the beach. Not so obvious from above, but more obvious from below. The path isn't as steep as it looks.
details.access: Park here: 50.280944, -5.249988 and follow the coastpath to the exit. Apprx 30min walk to the Sally's Bottom area where there's several distinct exits.
details.anchor: Bring a stake and short rope

details.notes: Awesome diving board exit point. There used to be a hike out from the middle of the beach but this has been taken out by landslide. It's now easiest to walk south to a sketchy trail that starts here: 50.264239, -5.290410. Low tides only.
details.access: Right next to the carpark on lighthouse hill.
details.anchor: Bring a stake and short rope, maybe some slings for securing the rope on the exit point.

details.notes: Mid - low tides only and no route out of the beach so bring a rope to ascend or paddle back to Portreath.
details.access: Exit is basically on the coastpath from Portreath.
details.anchor: Bring a stake and short rope

details.notes: Exit point is very close to ‘Hungry for apples’ but a distinct jump. Beach landing has no route out so you have to ascend a rope or paddle back to Portreath. Cool area for some adventuring. Low to mid tides only.
details.access: Easy access along the coastal path from Portreath.
details.anchor: Bring a stake and a short rope

details.notes: First cliff in Cornwall
details.access: Two minute walk from gravel car park
details.anchor: Bring your own stake and rope

details.notes: From the car park it's about 250/260ft to the beach but the start is quite positive and you have to jump through an enclosed gap about 60ft down. It is possible to hike down the brambly slope to left for a lower exit. This lower exit is 180ft, awkward, full of brambles and just generally shitty, but doable nonetheless. Only jumpable at very low tides. The hike back up is below the third car park east of this exit and is only accessible from this beach at spring low tides. The bit to watch out for is the protruding rocky section below the red, crumbling cliff near the hike out - if you can make it around that without swimming, you should be good.
details.access: You can pretty much jump from the car park...
details.anchor: Bring a stake and short rope

details.notes: About 140-150ft vertical to decent ledge and about 240ft overall. Exit roughly 10m to jumper's right of the left-most viewing point, you should be to the right of the wheelie bin on the ledge below... Hack through the brambles and gorse bush to the best looking exit. At very low tides it's possible to hike out to the next cove on jumpers left and follow an easy walking trail back up. Otherwise it is possible to scramble up the grassy slope on jumpers left, although steep, brambly and if wet, very slippery. Low tides only.
details.access: Park in the nearest carpark to the exit and follow the coast path for 5 minutes.
details.anchor: Bring a stake and short rope

details.notes: Several exits along the cliff, all roughly the same height. Low tide only. To get back up walk to the west side of the beach and there's a very steep 'path' leading back up. It's not entirely obvious and looks worse than it is.
details.access: Park in layby along nearest section of road and cut across the field.
details.anchor: Bring a stake and short rope

details.notes: Probably a couple exit points, but the best is a sketchy loose diving board about 2m down from the edge. Best to use a rope and be tied in. There's no path back up so you have to swim/paddle back to Nichols beach where there's a very steep and not so obvious path leading out on the west side of the beach. It would also be possible to ascend a rope and short way and then scramble out. Nice jump.
details.access: Park in the layby at the closest section of road and cut across the fields.
details.anchor: Bring a stake and short rope

details.notes: Slightly enclosed, onheadings preferable. Hike out is a steep scramble on jumper's right, look for the ropes. Probably the quickest turn around jump in Cornwall.

At the bridge take the right path along the river in the direction of the current. Follow it for 2 km flat and go up to the left at Grand Pomerolle via Pas de la Berthe. Go back down to the left to the top of Petit Pomerolle. There are several possible departures along the ridge below.

details.access: With the shuttle, go past the “Poujade” beach to “St Marguerite”, cross the bridge on the right to “Pierrefiche” then follow the Salve. 1 km after the Pierrefiche exit and 500 m after the last house, park at the junction of a track on the right. Follow the track on foot, take the left branch (markers) at the end of the climb, then continue to the end in the woods (30 mins). Take a marked path (orange) on the right which then leads along a ledge. Spot a steep descent in a wood (on the right) with orange markings, then passing at the foot of a cliff to reach the edge of the plateau, handrails in place at the end (15 mins). Exit upon arriving just before the platform for the large abseils of “Roc et Canyon” (carpet). Small coping 1 m against the bottom, small rope with knots in place.

details.notes: The LPO with whom we have very good relations in Aveyron asks us not to skip this exit between January 1 and August 31. Please respect this agreement.
details.access: Without a shuttle as for Favier then continue on the cornice for 10 minutes or with a small shuttle from Peyreleau via the path leading to the “prehistoric mushroom” then follow the cornice (1 hour steep) or via the plateau behind the big shuttle. When you are on the cornice path, look out for access to Curvelier marked by a red dot on a large boulder (clearly visible coming from the mushroom). Good flat area and exit to the right on a good raised step. Jump in a slight oblique upstream direction.

details.notes: The LPO with whom we have very good relations in Aveyron asks us not to skip this exit between January 1 and August 31. Please respect this agreement.
details.access: Without a shuttle, follow the track leading to the landing but without branching off until you reach the metal footbridge. Cross the Jonte (footbridge) or ford then go up opposite to join the GR. Follow the track upstream towards the face, then turn right towards the hermitage of St Michel (yellow markings) which you reach (45 mins). Follow the cornice path until you reach a clear and flat area which is at the top of Favier. Go towards the edge of the balcony and find the path which goes down to the left (cairn). Flat and clear exit, located to the right of the mooring points (15 mins). Superb view of the vases and loose rock.

The jumps located to the east of the Chinese vase ( Pandora , Loose Rock, Sodom, Rocket etc...) are in the natural park and are therefore prohibited. In fact, in this area, flying less than 500m above ground is not authorized. This large face, very well known to climbers, offers very beautiful jumps, some short and technical like that of the “Vase de Sèvre” ( Lilian Robert ) on which you have to climb and others more aerial and higher from 100 to 150 m with the “Roche decollée” ( Julien Caquineau in May 2001) with abseiling and climbing access, “Sodome” the same and further on the “Fusée” (easy access without any equipment) with its very beautiful pillar on a slight slope of almost 150m.
details.access: Either by Rozier via the Capluc rock, cornice path (with small shuttle) or from below from the emergency terminal parking lot (without shuttle).

From the opener: not very aesthetic spot but quick and easy to access.
details.access: This spot overlooks the N20 and Ariège. It is located on the other side of the valley from “Bucheronade”. Access is at the “Ariège évasé” sign (no real path for 5 minutes). We go up to the abandoned tin hut. Then there is no more path. After passing a small vertical wall, you have to go towards the exit by going around to the right the small wall which overlooks it. The last 50m are done passing through the bushes at best. The exit is obvious on a spoiler without vegetation which advances one meter.

details.notes: The very delicate aerology of the sector and in particular the wind coming down from the pass which can cause serious turbulence on landing when there is no wind in the wall. This spot is remarkable in every way. Do not throw stones, frequent presence of climbers
details.access: From Lescun follow the road to the motorway terminus. Go up to the Pétragème pass or Ansabe pass by a good path (you pass at the foot of the spot). From the pass, turn right following the cairns. Go down a small red corridor for about 40 meters and pull right into the face as soon as possible (cairns, II). We arrive at a small pass (splendid view of the needle). Climb the ridge to the summit (III). It is best to jump slightly to the right due to the presence of the pedestal.

details.notes: Non-precise location,There is a fee to visit the gorges, if the jump is made out of season access to the landing (for prior reconnaissance) is only possible via the river, on foot 500m after passing the Bar Des Cascades there is a small tunnel closed by a gate. At this level it is possible to pass by the river.
details.access: From Bayonne take the direction of Cambo then Saint Jean Pied de Port to go to the Iraty ski resort. Continue towards St Engrace. The Kakouetta gorges are just ahead on the right. Take the road then the path which runs along the left summit of the downstream gorges towards the upstream, always by car. After two kilometers the path gets closer and closer to the edge with very little vegetation (Edit 2020: vegetation is very present). The cliff is below and the start is a small grassy overhang marked by a spot of fluorescent paint.

details.access: At the exit of Vallon pont d'arc, take the tourist route of the gorges. Very quickly there is a bar called the cave of the tunnels. In the next bend a small staircase goes up on the left into the scrubland. We will easily find the exit above the road or rather the water.

Park behind the peak of Suèges on the road between Vézouillac and Fontaneilles, go straight into the hollow in the center of the hill via a good path, then once on the plateau go obliquely to the right, several departures possible. Be careful, however, of the poor quality of the rock at the summit. several paths starting from the fields and crossing the hamlet of Suèges allow you to return to the road and the car

details.notes: between 145 and 1000 meters
Strong spot
details.access: In Labastide-de-Virac, park in the car park near the cemetery. At the beginning take the same path which leads to Saleyron but turn a little further to the left. A small, well-marked path goes around it to the left then leads to Pas du Mousse just above the Cave. An IGN map can be useful.

From Vallon Pont d'Arc, take the Gorges de l'Ardèche road D290. About 1km after the Arche du Pont d'Arc, turn left into the village of Chames and park. Take the small path for around 600m, and go straight up into the valley on the left (scree slope). Arriving at the top of this valley, continue to the right along the cliff for around 300m, the exit seems quite obvious. Cliff named Bas Moulin on IGN map. Slight slope over the entire height of the face

details.notes: Technical. The waterfall is a little steep. The riverbed is chaotic with large rocks everywhere. The only options are scree, landslides here and there between the trees.
details.access: Refer to the Canyoning guide From Vallon pont d'Arc take the tourist route of the gorges, just after Chames, go over the small bridge. At the end of the climb, there is a small car park in the hairpin. Enter the path and turn right then left. Always going straight ahead, the path leads to the large scree from where you will have to descend little by little to find yourself at the edge of the void.

details.notes: Unique geological curiosity of Ardèche, vestige of a volcanic chimney highlighted by 8 million years of erosion, revealing a peak of hard rock which today rises 150 meters above the valley: The neck of Sceautre, biggest neck in Europe!
details.access: From Alba la Romaine join the N 102 towards Aubenas then 300 m after the roundabout turn right towards Sceautre and go there. A path behind the church leads to the top of the neck where the Virgin sits enthroned. Follow his right hand. The exit is not far away. Carefully check the axis of the jump because although the wall is overhanging, the top of the cliff as well as the foot are a little complex. Good experience jumping without a slider is preferred.

From Saint-Maurice-Navacelles take the D130 towards Navacelles then follow the direction of the Baume Oriol belvedere. Arriving there, park in the car park and head into the area of ​​the two cliff danger signs... between two bushes which open the way onto a slab. Three meters are available and recommended for gaining momentum. It is possible to park a car downstairs in the Navacelles car park.

On the D5 towards Moullans-sur-Ouveze take the first road on the right at the restaurant les tilleuls sign, before the D5-D40 intersection. Follow this road until the small stone bridge. Park in the dirt car park cross the bridge then 15 meters after the truck exit sign turn left and go straight up the hill following a fairly steep vague path which runs alongside a field then joins, after turning slightly to the left, at the top of the plateau a hiking path. Follow it to the left over the rocks and under the trees, when the markings on the ground indicate a viewpoint, go straight on. The start is located a few meters below.

Eyzahut is located 30 km east of Montélimar and 25 km south of Crest in Drome. From Eyzahut head towards the cliffs. At the edge of the forest there are signs indicating the ferret hole. Follow the marked path in the forest. After passing through the ferret's hole and at the top, no longer follow the directions and reach the edge of the cliff, walk along it more or less until you reach a crack which forms a small V in the void just before a curve (grass). Exit flat and comfortable, we can run! From the ground, you will easily find the path taken on the way up.

details.notes: The farmer who owns the place is favorable to our activity, and would like someone to come knock on his door to see people jumping, but it is preferable to avoid parking in front of his fields so that he can work without being embarrassed. Rp Maxime Castagné and Polo Raymond
details.access: From Nyons, take the D94 for 16 kilometers to Sahune. In the village, turn right towards Montréal les Sources. Cross the bridge over the Eygues and turn left to reach another small bridge which crosses the Ruisseau de Merderie then immediately right, take the direction of the Bramard farm. Pass in front of the farm then follow the bends which go up into the marl. Several exits possible. From the water reserve at the foot, it is possible to go up from the left, or from the right.

180m rope in place. Do not go into a wingsuit with a paragliding takeoff after 9 a.m., and before all the pargliders were placed in the evening.Very sensitive site.Located before takeoff, or possible bluffy flight diagonal.,

190m Vire pronounced on the left, well focus the push.

150m We jump between 2 enormous turns in a hole. a canel to descend to reach the ledge of exit.Provide a rope.

110m positive exit, total height of approximately 200m. Near 2 cairns.
120m Descent north of the cross in a bottleneck, then on 1 spit of 8 to find the north face.Take 8, nut and 15mbrochure.
100m Exit very positive 250m up to the bottom but you have to fly.
Exit: 90m positive extreme jump in wingsuit. From the left summit, in a dihedral.

at least 250m jump near a large antenna.

100m positive rope in place to go to exit. Tht lines at the posed.

Magnificent with a view of the Ventoux! Overlooking, running departure possible. Mef' at aerology.
details.access: From Belvédère, return to Monieux then turn right towards the Saint-Hubert farm, at the intersection with the D5 turn right. Once past the farm, in the first turn to the left take the path which goes to the right. Pass a house and turn left at the first intersection, the same at the next and park in the open space which will be on the left just after. Walk on the path towards the north, at the hairpin on the left a path leads towards the cliff. Once close to the void, look for an accessible rocky passage to go down one floor on the pillar, keep the void on your right and move towards the end, you will find a second rocky staircase passage which will take you to the floor below . All you have to do is cross the vegetation to reach the edge. An exit has been made in the stones to be able to take a few steps, or even run. (Small turn just a meter below to pass). At this point, you are vertical to the large yellow wall. It would be possible to walk from the Belvedere to the exit via a hiking path that goes down into the gorge and then back up. to dig.

details.notes: Made in static-line because there is a big turn halfway up (which still passes through the projection).
details.access: Park at the Point sublîme car park and reach it on foot, then take the path on the right which goes down along the cliff, walk about 100m, go down on a ledge to find the exit (rock at the edge of the void). We jump at the middle of the bend in the road.

details.notes: Alternative exit at Issioule Saint Maurin for the non-winged, perhaps safer for a low glider than the classic and which provides an extraordinary undersail. First followed by a “flyby” from Adrien Lilamand , who left just after on the wing, from the Wingsuit exit.
details.access: From the 853m hairpin on the RD952, take the path which goes up the Brusc ravine to join the GR4. Follow it north to the “viewpoints”. From the wingsuit exit, look to the left on the other side of the small cirque, there is a wall whose top is rounded and then drops slightly to the bottom. A rather characteristic rock emerges from the curve (see the photo), it's the exit!

details.notes: Avoid trips from mid-April to mid-June due to nesting!,Here we jump into a nature reserve which does not yet “explicitly” prohibit flying, so being very discreet is a minimum. The right flight line which wraps around the cliff of St Maurin is of rare beauty. It is forbidden to land on the large field below because it is a protected area. The landing can be done outside the Champ fence or on the large banks of the Verdon when the level is low.
details.access: From the 853m hairpin on the RD952, take the path which goes up the Brusc ravine to join the GR4. Follow it north to the “viewpoints”. We jump from the northernmost of the two, in the axis of the thalweg which descends to the landing field.

details.notes: Several exits possible on both sides of the V.
details.access: From Saou, cross the gorge and drive towards Aouste to Pas de Lauzens (a big “V” with a river flowing in the middle). Park just before crossing the V in a small space at the side of the road. Climb on the EAST side along the gap, there is not really a path and you will have to slip through the sometimes dense boxwoods. Arriving in a large scree you can see a characteristic triangular diving board on the wall, reach it by easily climbing the small rocky passage on the right. Once at the diving board, easily reach a higher point on the right on an overhang. The Exit is there, at a small triangular yellow rock. Pure vertical of around 70m, we recover 100m at the slightest impulse.

details.notes: The slopes are not very small but very bumpy and strewn with stones, large shoes and protection are very recommended! Carefully analyze the weather and aerological conditions which can be tricky in such relief. Given the quality of the landings, prefer a jump in calm conditions or in a weak west, west, south-west trend. In any case, presence of three 4m high crosses
details.access: From Roquebrune, take the D7 towards the north towards Le Muy, 200m before the bridge over the Argens, turn left to take the road which passes between the rock (to the south) and l'Argens (to the north). Continue to a small parking lot at the base of the rock where there is a map of the area. Walk following the yellow markings to the top of the Trois Croix. When you arrive, pass to the right of the first cross and go down a few meters to reach the large advance. Go to the end of it and on your right below you will have a beautiful triangular and very flat exit (Original Exit). A second exit is very obvious, before the first, easier to access and on a point on the side of a scale. ()

details.notes: No skipping from mid-April to mid-June due to nesting!
details.access: From the 853m hairpin on the RD952, take the path which goes up the Brusc ravine to join the GR4. Follow it north to the “viewpoints”. The exit is to the right of the wingsuit exit, on the next pillar. You have to climb a little to go down one floor and then reach the edge by walking through the vegetation. Once the rocky point is reached, the exit is obvious, reach it very carefully (aerial, unstable rock).

details.notes: height 55m with a beautiful little lunule

details.access: In the Raujoles Saint Martin business park at the Mobalpa roundabout follow the direction camping St Martin, go past it then in a large hairpin take the path on the right (small parking spaces and information panel) towards the cliff follow it until it lands. From the landing reach the bottom of the ridge visible to the left of the cliff follow this ridge then a series of small screes up to the summit, go right in the boxwoods downhill for a few tens of meters, reach the summit via an easy climb of the rocky spur the start is at the end of it.

openedBy.name: Jeremie Labaeye , Philippe Bermon , Maurice Mahieu , Riquier Vincendeau-Verbraeken

details.notes: Very nice area, but sensitive. Great swimming spot!!
details.access: From Chateauvert, enter the Vallon Sourn and park under the spot (main cliff of the Vallon, a large conch/climbing spot) Facing the wall, go left to the emergency call terminal, take the mini path which leaves to the right of it and goes up to the exit. Locate the exit from the landing (highest point), presence of a solid tree to attach the cord.

details.notes: Very nice area, but sensitive. Stay discreet! Great swimming spot!
details.access: Same thing as for Susuk but once at the top, go left and cross the pine forest to find the exit. Locate the exit from the landing.

details.notes: Very nice area, but sensitive. Stay discreet!! Great swimming spot!!
details.access: From Chateauvert, enter the Vallon Sourn, pass a sort of parking lot with shelters on the left, you will then have a long straight line with a huge field on the right (the land). The jump is the one on the other side of the river. Leave the field at the small beach, put yourself in the shoes of a wild boar and let your imagination run wild! The approach begins with a wet crossing...

Park at the Ferme de l'Estang (at 44.642443, 5.087533) at the crossroads where the walk begins and follow Pas de la Berthe then Grand Pomerolle (indications). Once at the top, you will have to cross the jungle and cross a gap via a dead tree to reach the edge. Several possible exits, all as rounded and rotten as each other. Great caution! The few meters of rope that fit well can be very useful.

details.notes: A little involved because of the confinement, it nevertheless remains a magnificent jump for the visual at the exit and under sail.
details.access: Park at Col de la Chaudière and go up towards Veyou via the path laid out with steps and the Pas de Siara. The exit is very obvious, super overflowing but very confined. Mef for orientations, equipment adapted to this type of jump strongly recommended. The last meters are rather impressive, even if everything is done without equipment. The best is to go a few meters to the left of the only shrub present.

details.notes: Made in static-line because I had underestimated the height of the face seen from below. So I had barely braked. The jump seems possible by hand. to have.
details.access: Go to the small hamlet south of the massif at the entrance to the Blaches valley (44.450742, 5.945928). Take the path that leads into the valley. After crossing a large ravine, look for a small path on the right which will take you up to the summit. You will then have to reach the south of the massif by crossing the forest. The exit is near a point where the rock is red (obvious). Good slope!!
details.anchor: breaking rope and cord just in case

details.notes: Very beautiful place but the jump remains, from every point of view, technical and not very safe...
details.access: From Muy, drive towards Bagnols-en-forêt and enter the Blavet gorges. After a hairpin turn to the left, park in the orientation table parking lot. Go down the road and take the path which takes the hairpin bend towards the gorges. Go back up the gorges to find the obvious exit. Access to the exit is a little aerial, it is better to be comfortable climbing.

From Muy, drive towards Bagnols-en-forêt and enter the Blavet gorges. After a hairpin turn to the left followed by parking lots, continue for around 600m and park on the left at the start of a track. Follow the track 500/600m until an intersection. Take the track on the right which climbs to the top of the cliffs. Once high enough, you will have to leave the path and cross the vegetation to reach the edge. Exit on the side of a large rock which seems to be in balance (you must descend carefully on it). Presence of a climbing belay to anchor the static line.

From Cabasse, drive towards Lac de Carcès and park on the right at the intersection of the D13 and the D79. Take the path that runs along the river until you reach the entrance to a property. Take the path to the right of the entrance to find the landing a few meters on the right. From there you can find the exit. Retrace your steps and climb the cliff via the ridge via a mini climbers' path. The exit is on a slab from which a small rectangular rock emerges, perfect for sitting!

The tip of the west entrance to Vallon Sourn on the right bank.From Châteauvert, drive 800m south towards Brignoles and park on the side of the road. The jump is visible from here. No path for access, climb the embankment without too much trouble. Obvious exit (cord in place). Push well!

details.notes: Jump of questionable usefulness, however the landing is very nice. Very low height, it is necessary to go slightly to the left to avoid opening into the tree below, then quickly re-focus the flight towards the landing, avoiding getting caught in the large pine halfway up the slope.
details.access: The tip of the west entrance to Vallon Sourn on the left bank From Châteauvert, enter Vallon Sourn and park after the first big left turn. The exit will be on your left (small yellow conch). To access it first climb to the foot of the wall then go around it to the left until you find a dihedral that is easy to climb. Some climbing steps will be necessary. At the top the exit is obvious.

details.notes: By car shuttle, it will take around 1 hour 20 minutes to return to the car, trudging through the scree to reach the intermediate ridge line and the outward trail.
details.access: From Sisteron, take the direction of Saint-Geniez, shortly before entering the Pierre-Ecrite gorge, park at the sign Col de Fontebelle 16.9km (see photo) and take the path which goes north next to it. . Arriving on the intermediate ridge line (at the level of the grassy clearings), pull to the right so as to follow the electric fence on the left. Follow the small path to the top (cairns). At the top, follow the gap towards the East until you find the exit on a slab (see photo).

details.notes: Obvious exit at the level of a very marked overhang. The best is to start from the triangular rock to the right of the large slab, and push towards the left end of the field. There is a ledge 50m below which advances 2m under the jump and 4-5m on each side, take advantage of the 3 possible momentum steps.
details.access: From Sisteron, head towards Saint-Geniez as far as the small gorges of the Gache mountain. Stop at the Written Stone. Go up following the hiking trail, arriving on the forest path (at a large, very beautiful dead tree) turn left and follow it towards the west. You will then have to cross the vegetation to reach the void.

From Tallard, drive towards Sisteron and take the bridge towards Laragne at Monêtier-Allemont. Directly after this, turn right and go up along the canal. Take the second on the left (at the sign Chemin de Crigne; Petite Queylane, Reserve DFCI) and park 400m further on in a small space above the crow's feet. Take the marked path and follow it until you come across a wide track for wood-cutting machines. Turn left on it then leave it a few hundred meters further on to cross the vegetation and reach the void. The exit is reached by carefully descending to a sloping slab. The jump is towards the East-South-East with enough to take 2-3 steps.

details.notes: Super spilling!!! and 3 no momentum possible. A truly magnificent spot if there was a real landing... I made this jump at a time of day when the thermals were well established in the slope. After being orbited, I was actually able to reach the fields at the bottom (which are, in calm conditions, out of range).
details.access: Go to 44.365732, 5.853502 and go up along the large fields then follow the hiking trail which goes up to the Col du Colombier passing between the cliffs. Visual on the wall while walking (left). Once at the top, head west and reach the exit easily (I put a small cairn).

details.notes: 100, 110 and 130 meters
details.access: In Saillans take the Col de la Chaudière road. Park at the pass and take the Siara pass to gain a foothold on the plateau. Take it on the left towards the Roche Rousse rocks. Do not jump at the top but on a spur on the left looking at the Col de la Chaudière
details.anchor: rounded start which may require a rope

details.notes: Very beautiful visual!
details.access: At the Castillon dam, go around the power station on the left via the path and climb up to the gap, a little before the second large pylon. The exit (a beautiful slab) is located a few meters to the right of a small scrap iron saddled in the rock, above the first turquoise blue basin. To return, climb straight up the embankment until you find a path that returns to the dam (15min).

details.notes: Synchronized opening with Pierre Lebreton on Digne Verso , the southern rocky bar of the “V” :)
details.access: From Digne les Bains, drive in the direction of the V and turn left onto Chemin de Mouiroues (D19) at the Pont du Pigeonnier (see IGN map). Continue to the first path on the left with the gate and climb the ridge line starting directly from it (do not pass through the property). The exit is at a vertical pillar a little before the high point. By leaning over and looking to the right you should see a via ferrata passing across the face. (but several starts of different heights across the entire bar).

details.notes: Stay discreet, those posed are either private or in town! Synchronized opening with Timothée Maurel on Digne Recto , the northern rocky bar of the “V” :)
details.access: From Worth the Baths head east on the D 20 in the direction of the thermal baths 700m after that, a hiking path (on the left), goes up towards the St Pancrace chapel. Once arrived at the chapel, continue to the right of it until the viewpoint and then again to the right along the cliff for 30m to 50m

details.notes: Very aesthetic jump with an incredible slope
details.access: From Serres, drive towards Laragne and turn left onto the D21 towards Savournon. The jump is very visible (the southern end of the large rocky bar facing west), park a car as close as possible at the hamlet of Chantaussel. Retrace your steps and take the direction of Savournon and turn right a little before the village on the D221 and go up to the car park in the undergrowth. Take the hiking trail heading west (signposted to the cave). Arrive at an intersection of several paths, turn right up to the ridge line then follow it southwards to the exit (several departures possible).

Park the car on the small path which goes to the right just after the railway. From there, go back north on foot for 100m and take the first path which goes on the right, continue for 8 minutes and go up on that if, and then due south through the forest, the exit is towards the de of Bouchier Ridges.

details.notes: 10 m of rope required to check the exact location of the jump
details.access: From Glandage follow the D539 towards the Gorges des Gats, 500 meters after leaving the village turn left at the small sewage treatment plant, from there a hiking path leaves on the right at a small bridge, follow it on foot and go up into the forest on the right by means of a small bridge which spans the stream. Continue on the path for another 40 minutes until the IGN Fouseau sign and head due north on the small line of ridges towards the D of Défilé. The exit is to the right of a dead tree lying on the ground.

From Gresse take the d546 towards the South-East for 1.5 km, then the first left at the Col de Mévouillon sign, park the car in the hamlet and take the small hiking path which goes up to the top of the fort. Exit towards the indication IGN 1108. It is possible to climb in Autonav from the landing in 40 minutes via a path that passes under the jump

From the village, follow the direction of Gréolières les neiges then park under the ruins at the hairpin on the left, shortly after leaving the village. A hiking trail starts behind the stone hut and climbs onto the ridge. The jump is on the upper part of the bar (see photo), cord in place. Other departures seem possible (but not really higher)

From Gréolières, take the D2 towards Thorenc. A few hundred meters after the tunnels, park in the right bend (space on the left of the road). Walk 50m towards the west then climb the embankment on the right. Once at the top, follow the gap towards the EAST until the obvious exit. The various rocky peaks pass without problem.

Go by car to Domaine des Courmettes on the south face of the massif. From there a marked hiking trail starts. Once at the top the exit is on a small promontory on the left upon arrival, in the only place that is approximately vertical. The jump is well enclosed, especially on the left where a rocky ridge with dead trees blocks the trajectory a little. Instead, jump to the right of the second dead tree. For the return, go to the North East corner of the landing, you will find a track which leads back to the Domaine.

Park in the village of Gourdon, take the road which goes up to the left of the Bar Tabac inn at the small roundabout. Shortly after, follow the indicated hiking trail to go up to the Cavillore plateau. Once out of the housing estates the path goes to the left. There is an intersection further up the trail where you will need to turn right. Once on the plateau, head EAST to reach the cliffs and follow them towards the North until a path continues on the side of the cliff, under the top of it. Do not follow it and reach the top then continue until the exit marked by a Cairn.

Park in the village of Gourdon, take the road which goes up to the left of the Bar Tabac inn at the small roundabout. Shortly after, follow the indicated hiking trail to go up to the Cavillore plateau. Once out of the housing estates the path goes to the left. There is an intersection further up the trail where you will need to turn right. Once on the plateau, head EAST to reach the cliffs and follow them towards the North until a path continues on the side of the cliff, under the top of it. Take it, the exit is a few dozen meters further on a fairly obvious beak.

Park in the village of Gourdon, take the road which goes up to the left of the Bar Tabac inn at the small roundabout. Shortly after, follow the indicated hiking trail to go up to the Cavillore plateau. Once out of the housing estates the path goes to the left. There is an intersection further up the trail where you will need to turn right. Once on the plateau, head EAST to reach the cliffs and follow them towards the North until a path continues on the side of the cliff, under the top of it. Do not follow it and reach the high summit then continue until the exit which is difficult to explain.

details.notes: Quick and very pleasant jump. The exit is geologically quite pretty.
details.access: Park at the side of the road towards the landing and go down along the river then cross it. You must then climb the embankment well to the left to be able to access the ridge which will lead to the obvious exit.

From Moydans, drive towards Gap (East) for 1.5km to the Col de Palluel where you will have to turn right. Stop a few hundred meters further on at the information panel on the right (with a wooden bench). From here the path goes up to the exit. The exit is rather obvious, on a grassy platform about 40m to the right of the clearly identifiable pillar (fairy chimney).

Park in the village of Gourdon, take the road which goes up to the left of the Bar Tabac inn at the small roundabout. Shortly after, follow the indicated hiking trail to go up to the Cavillore plateau. Once out of the housing estates the path goes to the left. There is an intersection further up the trail where you will need to turn right. Once on the plateau, head EAST to reach the cliffs and follow them north to the exit.

details.notes: Positive jump, aggressive visual and big impulse necessary in low slider.
details.access: Park in the village of Saint Jeannet in the car park at 43.750010, 7.144696. Then follow the hiking path which goes above towards “baou de Saint Jeannet”. Once at the top, you have to go down to the first projection to the right of that of the star and the solar panels. You will easily find the exit from the La mal-efic route with a small sign and climbing signs.
Enter the village, go up to the entrance of the citadel, pay the entrance and climb the rock until exit seems correct using a laser

Park in the small car park behind the west pier of the Pont Mirabeau on the right bank. Walk along the Durance towards the south on the track until you reach the low point of the ridge line where the (obvious) jump is located. Climb the ridge line easily until the exit, a beautiful rock slab with a bush to anchor the static line. You can get close to the vehicle jump, but the path is pretty bad in places.

openedBy.name: Timothée Maurel , Eric Dambrine , Mic Veler and Yo

details.access: From Seranon, take the Route Napoléon towards the South then leave it a little later to head towards Mons. Drive for around 1.6km more and park next to the small tarmac path which goes up to the right (red and white sign). Take this path and follow it. It passes through an old holiday center and goes around the massif to the right. Arrived at the top, at the level of a rusty can on the left (or right) of the path and a hunter's perch, (43.748916, 6.719889) join the ridge line on the left. Pass the summit cairn, the exit is then obvious (in the middle of the cirque above the slope).

details.notes: Superb running start!! (mef, it's still bumpy) Slope jump in the upper part and positive in the lower part, even if 120m are available, keep in mind that a row will open closer to the wall than one by hand with small delays.
details.access: Park at Annot station. Go down the station entrance slope and pass under the track on the right. On the other side, turn right then straight on until the start of the hiking trail. Two possibilities are available to you, the red and the blue (like in Matrix). I personally followed the blue path towards The king's room which goes around the massif to the right and passes under the jump. Once at the top, head south to reach the edge of the void. The exit is obvious (see photos). There is a small ledge a few meters below which blocks the view but without any difficulty in crossing in the projection. You will also have a small shrub hedge on your left. Here you will be above the highest vertical available.

details.notes: Asked privately (fence), be discreet and respectful.
details.access: Cross the village of Eyzahut and turn left at the tennis court, towards the campsite. Then turn right to skirt the campsite on the right, at the top at the intersection take the path furthest to the right (chemin de la tournelle). Continue until 50m before the yurt (just before the last house), a path leaves on the right of the road. Follow it, always going straight ahead to reach the top of the rock via the equipped fault. The exit is 2m to the left of the summit cairn, oriented towards the village and the nuclear power plant that can be seen in the distance.

Leave the village of Soyons towards the south and turn right towards the Caves. Park and take the path to the summit where the leaning tower of Soyons is located. Then walk south to reach the exit on a promontory (rope in place). The start is positive, don't hesitate to push hard.
Easy access via the plateau following the paragliding decoration route

openedBy.name: Timothée Maurel , Eric Dambrine , Mic Veler and Yo

details.notes: Pure vertical of approximately 36m, the slightest impulse gives you approximately 45m. The exit is comfortable, the embankment is steep (excellent glide margin) and we could land two A380s on the touchdown. Good spot to familiarize yourself with low/very low jumps.
details.access: Coming from Pouzin, once you enter Flaviac, turn left at the central crossroads. Cross the bridge and pass a left turn, park at the first crow's foot just after. Take the road on the right and the path going off to the right a few dozen meters further on. Follow it, it goes around the massif, and once behind (on the southern slope) the path will make a hairpin to the right then one to the left. After the latter, cut through the vegetation and towards the north as soon as it becomes less dense. Now you just have to reach the edge then the summit. The exit is extremely obvious, on a step located under the light installation in the shape of a shooting star.
Go to Le Claps south of Luc en Diois, easily find the via ferrata, take it until you find yourself above the railway line (slightly offset to the left of it).

openedBy.name: Pierre Lebreton , Matthieu Porcheron , Vincent Martinod and Timothée Maurel

details.access: From Luc en Diois, take the direction of Gap, pass the Claps and stop 11km further on on the right (grass area and access to the river). The jump is on the other side of the road. Join the railway line and follow it south towards the tunnel. Climb to the left of it to reach the ridge line which rises to the exit (rock above the gap, obvious)

From Chateauvert, enter the Sourn valley and park in the large car park equipped with umbrellas on the left of the road. On foot, take the road in the same direction to continue into the Valley. Cross the long straight line with the field and go to the large overhanging conch and find the emergency call terminal which is located before it, on the left of the road. Follow the mini path which climbs to the right of the terminal, turning left once at the top to cross the ridge where the jump is located. You must now cross the pine forest to the exit. This is opposite the north end of the large field.

details.notes: No trail, it's pure wild boar. Axle a little to the right at the exit
details.access: From Châteauvert, drive 700m into Vallon Sourn and park in a space to the right of the road (with signs and a path blocked by large rocks). On foot, retrace your steps to the sort of mini-quarry in the embankment (around 150/200m from the car). From here, climb the embankment and go around the cliff to the right to climb on top. Walk west to find the exit.

Several possibilities: Go up via Pallon (1h30) or Fressinières (towards the Col des Lauzes, starting from Les Aujards or even the Col 45min). Follow the GR. The GPS is useful so that you don't have to search for the exit for too long on the slopes of the forest. A well-marked path and a few cairns lead to the exit.

details.notes: Access is without a rope, but it would be interesting to protect an exposed passage with a fixed rope
details.access: From L'Argentière La bessée (or via Fressinières in winter depending on snow conditions) go up to the Col des Lauzes. From the pass go behind Lac des Lauzes and climb almost straight into the forest. Once at the top of the forest, go down the slope and follow the ridge line to the right until the exit which is at the top of the face which forms a sort of triangle (Cairn in place).

details.notes: Large undersail in the gorges. Be careful, the landing is located in the narrowest of the gorges, ensure good air conditions. It is highly recommended to locate this to visualize the approach (invisible from the exit). A fence borders it to the south and there are numerous trees. Missing the landing is not really a situation for the future.
details.access: From the village of Courmes, follow the hiking trail which goes south towards Pic des Courmettes for approximately 1 km. Then head due west through the forest until the gap and find the beak in question (rather obvious). exit coordinates: 43.735182, 7.002531

At the north exit of Volx, head west towards Dauphin. Park at the entrance to the quarry and take the track which goes up to the chapel. Once at the top, follow the direction of the castle ruins, and past them, go down a little towards the east to find an exit above the highest vertical available (rope in place).

details.notes: A few steps of momentum possible and desirable, the face is vaguely vertical on the first half then overhanging. two pillars are present on each side of the jump
details.access: From Gap, take the N94 towards the EAST (Chorges, Lac de Serre Ponçon...), reach the small village of La Rochette, where it is possible to park next to the cemetery. Follow the road which goes EAST once at the top, take the first track on the left towards the summit of Chapeau. The exit is approximately 20 meters to the right of the barriers, after the first V at the top of the cliff.

details.notes: Under sail of space but technical pose!!! The hand is to be preferred, as much for the fact that the cliff returns quickly after the overhanging part, as for the finesse necessary to reach a passable landing.
details.access: Park in the village of Jonchères, and take the path which goes west and which begins opposite the northernmost house in the village. Climb to the top of the ridge line then head north to find the cliff. Several possible exits (identify carefully)

details.notes: Starting running three steps (or more) possible. Big slope at this location. Very profitable jump: autonav' not too long, very easy access, comfortable exit, significant slope, beautiful under sail and easy landing. Very good for starting/progressing in low sliders.
details.access: From Laragne, drive approximately 7km towards Serres (towards the WEST) and turn right to pass under the railway line. Continue the road along the lake on the left, turn right at the intersection with the car park. Continue 400m, pass another intersection, continue straight and take the first small road on the left. Go up until the road is blocked by a rope. A hiking path starts from here (to the left of the road), follow it up to the ridge. Once at the top, follow the ridge eastwards for around 700m, until you find a cairn on the path with a grassy ledge/platform on the right. Go down on it, the exit is at the level of the bush-cairn. To find your way, you jump to the right of a large pillar and a few dozen meters to the left of the large gully in the embankment. To return to the car, go down the Chemin du Posé, a little before the hamlet turn left at the intersection, then right at the next one. Continue the road and find the small road which goes up from the start of the walk on the right.

details.notes: 10m of rope to descend to the exit
details.access: From Rochemaure (near Montélimar) take the direction of Meysse (North) and drive about 1 km. We pass under the big black rock. Park in the car park before the roundabout. Climb the rock by going around it to the right in the scree and find a passage to climb (4a 4b).   At the top you will have to go down to the left in a bad, unstable passage until you reach a point. Being comfortable climbing is highly recommended even if the climb is short (lol). Access to the tip is quite dangerous too!!! Static line recommended, positive jump!!

From the USA Tir shooting range (in St-Didier-sous-Aubenas) head towards Montélimar and drive approximately 3.4 km. At the roundabout, turn left into the industrial zone and cross it to the track junction where you will have to park the car. Walk on the path which goes north, turn left at the first crow's foot and turn left 200m after this on the small path which climbs to the edge of the cliffs. Move around so that you are approximately above the shooting gallery to find one of the possible exits.

details.notes: Turns at opening height which reduces the slope of the jump. By autonavigation, the return to the decoration is via a path on the north face. In case of scree laying, it can also be reached by following the foot of the face towards the EAST (WARNING risk of falling stones and very unstable embankment).
details.access: From Laragne, follow the direction of the Méouge gorges and the free flight site. Once at the decorative carpet, reach the void and find a well-marked diving board (slightly EAST of the carpet decoration).

details.notes: The access described above is the original access, it is pure wild boar and passes through exhibition areas! It would surely be more reasonable to try to cross the river before entering the gorge to climb directly to the top of the rocky bar where it is easier and above all less dangerous to walk.
details.access: Go to the village of Le Saix (05) near Veynes and cross it. then head towards the parade and park just before the entrance.  Walk towards the entrance and climb on the rocky bar on the right at the “Chemin Artistique” sign. Follow the gap to the top, you will pass next to a very marked diving board, the exit is a little further (around 50m, see photo)

To get to the place: from Argis take the direction of Saint Rambert en Bugey, 1 km after passing the Saint Rambert football stadium, turn left onto the bridge which passes over the Albarine river and the railway, and turn left again along the railway lines, until you reach a crow's foot (the car park). Access to the jump: go in the direction of Argis, turn left at the roundabout, and left again to take the D 104 towards “le Pavaz, Averliaz” after passing Averliaz continue for another 3km until arriving at the Suerme plateau, and park at the end of the path. Then go down for 5 minutes in the woods towards the cliff.

details.notes: 150m a point of 12 with Plauqette to go to the exit
next to a dry tree
approximate height
Climbing in your 4+
exit very hard

Take enough rope to make a 10m rappel. Access can be experienced as mentally taxing because the progression can seem long and tedious. The few tens of minutes spent fighting against the forest to cross areas dense with vegetation almost got the better of the composure and courage of Pierre Lebreton , although known for his rusticity. After some encouragement, he finally knew how to draw from deep within himself the last resources he had left to finish this journey. Pants and long-sleeved t-shirts are not a luxury. Presence of a fig tree at the bridge in the village to regain some strength.
details.access: From the small park at the entrance, walk south into the village and turn left after the small bridge to take the hiking trail. This arrives on a larger track, turn left on it then take the hiking trail which takes a right again 250 m further on. Rebelotte arriving on a second, wider track, turn left and walk enough so that the relief on your right is possible for you to climb. So climb the embankment through the dense and sometimes aggressive vegetation until you come across a final track at the top on which you will have to take the right (towards the west). Simply follow it and leave it when it goes south to maintain a westward heading and cross the vegetation until it reaches the void. Once you arrive, go down to the pillar via a small rappel in a fault and reach the north-facing exit (closed to the right).

details.notes: Opener's comment  : This jump is a tribute to Jean-Jacques Bié Papi Base who died on July 8, 2013 in Brunas (Paragliding). We had to open it together. It is located in the axis of the “butterfly path”. It's a clean jump with a very nice visual and a beach landing. Be careful, however, during periods of heavy flow in the Hérault River and especially when the road is prohibited (heavy traffic)!
details.access: Two possibilities. Either from the parking lot of the “grotte des Demoiselles” via the blue path (departure from the end of the parking lot on the west side after the entrance to the cave). Either by parking in the last hairpin of the road (one-way) which goes down from the caves before joining the Ganges road. From there go back up the road for 100 meters and take the path which goes up to the foot of the wall. The via ferrata starts on the right facing the wall. At the exit of the first chimney, join the ledge on the right with the empty side (without using the zip line) and follow the ledge (it is no longer the via) and reach the plateau (kairn) and up to the blue path. Follow it downstream. Pass a stone shelter and follow a path which goes towards the edge of the cliff without visual effects (kairn). If you arrive on a platform with a rope it is 50m. You must continue to follow the ridge downstream for 100m to find the highest point (kairn). Easy 2m descent, obvious exit between 2 cades.
details.anchor: harness + lanyard if you go through the chimney of the via ferrata.

details.access: From Navacelles, leave the village by the only possible road and turn right at the first crow's foot (D130E7 direction Blandas). About 3km further on you pass a tight hairpin on the right, you will have to stop about 600m later in a space on the right of the road (in a left turn). A path starts here which will pass under the pillar. After passing it, simply reach the top by going up a thalweg and head towards the exit. To start from the ledge, and when you are facing the void, you have to turn right and find a relatively easy place to de-climb. From the very top, it is better to start from the left side, where the ledge advances the least and where running is possible.

locations.name: Être à l'heure c'est déjà être en retard

details.access: Go to Pas de Magnan (en 43.505787, 5.61863) and park in one of the spaces along the road. Climb the ridge following the rocky bar towards the West for approximately 1.6 km. The exit at the level of a slab in a part where the cliff is very vertical, and next to a dead tree hanging on the edge of the void (43.502021, 5.598825). Return 20 minutes following the path to the EAST.

details.notes: Approximate location
details.access: From Saint-Félix-de-l'Héras, take the D155 towards the east and park in the small car park in front of the barriers. Follow the path of the Escalette Cliff Circuit. Once on the plateau, continue to follow the path for around 200 m and turn right on a vague path.. the exit is on the last Bec (rather on the left)

details.notes: Approximate location, Overhanging cliff, flight above the highway just before the tunnels. Rock crumbly in places.
details.access: From Saint-Félix-de-l'Héras, take the D155 towards the east and park in the small car park in front of the barriers. Follow the path of the Circuit des cliffs de lEscalette. Once on the plateau, continue on the track and follow it for 1km. From this place reach the edge of the cliff on the left... A small advance near a tree allows you to have a view of the cliffs on the right, the exit is easily identifiable from this place.

details.notes: Approximate location, Very overhanging cliff, static start from a superb slab. Possibility of taking a few steps to the right of the slab. You can also jump from the very beautiful Carmina cave 10m below the exit (147m): place a full empty abseil of 15 meters on small trees. Exit opened by Jéronimo on 15/12/2012.
details.access: From Montpellier take the N109 to Gignac then the D32 to Aniane. Then follow the Hérault gorges road to St Guilhem and park in the village. Follow the path at the exit of the village which leads to the Cirque de l'Infernet. Take the first path which goes up to the left at the foot of a small wall. 300 meters before the big wall, take the path on the left which reaches the top of the cliff. The spot is visible from the path, you must leave the path to follow a climber's track for 350 meters towards the west

details.notes: Approximate location
details.access: From Montpellier take the N109 to Gignac then the D32 to Aniane. Then follow the Hérault gorges road to St Guilhem and park in the village. Follow the path at the exit of the village which leads to the Cirque de l'Infernet. Take the first path which goes up to the left at the foot of a small wall. 300 meters before the big wall, take the path on the left which reaches the top of the cliff. Continue to the top of the cirque then head towards the “combe du vent” sector on the east side. The spot is above the Carmina slightly on the right when you are facing the void

openedBy.name: Gillian Hamcy , David Degrado and Vincent Martinod

details.notes: Vertical cliff with a steep embankment on the left at 60 meters vertical BE CAREFUL in case of 90 right. Take 3 meters of cord to lay a Static-Line if you are not comfortable with congested hand jumps.
details.access: From Montpellier take the N109 to Gignac then the D32 to Aniane. Then follow the Hérault gorges road to St Guilhem and park in the village. Follow the path at the exit of the village which leads to the Cirque de l'Infernet. Take the first path which goes up to the left at the foot of a small wall. 300 meters before the big wall, take the path on the left which reaches the top of the cliff. Continue to the top of the cirque then head towards the “combe du vent” sector on the west side. The spot is above the Carmina, slightly to the left when you are facing the void. You have to go down about ten meters into the valley of the wind before coming across a small handrail which leads to the exit.

details.notes: Slightly overhanging cliff with a superb view of the 6 exits facing the North
details.access: From Montpellier take the N109 to Gignac then the D32 to Aniane. Then follow the Hérault gorges road to St Guilhem and park in the village. Follow the path at the exit of the village which leads to the Cirque de l'Infernet. Take the first path which goes up to the right towards the North in the village of St Guilhem. Arrived on the plateau after 20 minutes, look for a climber's path which goes 90 degrees to the left towards the South.

20 mins. From the car park, go down the access path to the creek until you find a small passage on the right allowing you to cross the creek. Climb the fairly steep embankment until you reach a small ruin. Go around the large rock in the middle in wild boar mode to the right then gradually descend towards the obvious exit, a small vertical ridge.

openedBy.name: Thibaut Zevaco , Loïc Tamburello , and Gillian Hamcy

details.notes: Very approximate location, In winter and after heavy rains the landfall is underwater.
details.access: Park in front of the Agonès water tower, follow the marked path towards the Micisse cross. Once you arrive at the Cross, head towards the East and the gap following small cairns, the exit will be rather easy to find thanks to its beak and the rope in place.

details.notes: Very approximate location
details.access: Take the road which leads to the Gouffre de Gourfouran. Park on the left in a small car park 2 kilometers before Pallon. The parking lot is at the end of a climb around a bend and overlooks a viewpoint. Once parked, go down towards the cliff then follow it for around fifty meters towards the South to find the exit. The car shuttle takes approximately 5 minutes.

15 minutes on foot: Park in the paid car park furthest west of St Guilhem le Désert (the police check tickets, etc.). Take the path that leads to the ruins of the fortified castle. 300 meters before arriving there head towards the cliff using an easy climb which leads to a rock which overlooks the car park. The exit is quite obvious but spotting it from the car park makes access easier.

details.notes: Warning: ban March 15 to June 15 Nesting regulations and decree from March 15 to June 15 valid for the via-Ferrata. Sensitive sector during this period.
details.access: Without a shuttle, park 1.5 km after Monna on the right. Take a path in the infield bend under the power line (yellow marked) and climb towards the cliff, pass in front of the 2 caves on the right then climb onto the plateau via a corridor (35 mins). Follow the path then the via ferrata in reverse for 10 minutes. The exit faces the Millau viaduct and the village of Monna, to the left of a rope bridge. From the landing, walk 10 minutes to reach the car. With shuttle, from the access via the plateau (via-ferrata), going up towards the Puncho d'Agast, continue the road for 4 km then track on the right to the car park, then on foot from the barrier to the sign (20 min), turn right and do the via ferrata in reverse.

locations.name: via ferrata de la saix de Miolène

details.access: Park at the via car park and follow the return path from the via in the opposite direction for 25 minutes. The path goes around the cliff from above and arrives at the end of the via where the rather obvious exit is located.

openedBy.name: Gillian Hamcy , Loïc Tamburello and Antony Newton

locations.name: via ferrata de la tête de l'éléphant

details.access: 25 minutes: Park at the via car park and follow the path which leads to the start, follow the via until you arrive near the summit where the exit is obvious.

openedBy.name: Gillian Hamcy, Loïc Tamburello and Antony Newton

details.notes: sensitive spot, nesting of peregrine falcons from February to the end of June, ban on jumping during this period, in addition the amorous displays begin in January, therefore to be avoided from January onwards.
details.access: 0 minutes with shuttle: Park at the Tête de Chien panorama car park. The fairly obvious exit is only accessible from the fort which is unfortunately not accessible to the public... First locate the exit from the panorama.

GPS points of the jump 41.375050, 9.176928 In Bonifacio, take the D260 towards the lighthouse and park on the lower side; the spot is 2 minutes away. 2 possible running starts, one at 105m, and the other at 97m

details.notes: super low
details.access: Park at the Granède paragliding takeoff and follow a track towards the North East, once you arrive at the oppidum continue towards the North for 4 minutes. Note Jéronimo: Possibility of access by car from the D809 by parking in a bend going uphill from Millau on the Combe de la Granède side. Reach the oppidum in 15 minutes. GPS coordinates of exit 44.090910, 3.110604

details.notes: Clean exit, large platform to prepare, slight slope.
details.access: From Millau take the direction of Cavallerie / Montpellier, pass the panorama in a large right turn then turn around higher up to retrace your steps (direction Cavallerie-Millau. Park in the car park, then head towards the signs and the metal railing, the descent is at the level of the description Boffi. On the plateau, the exit is on the North side.
GPS points of the jump 41.377139, 9.175056 In Bonifacio, take the D260 towards the lighthouse and park in a hairpin next to the ruins. The spot is 2 minutes away in the middle of old ruined bunkers.

details.notes: Approximate location
details.access: From Millau take the direction of Cavallerie / Montpellier, pass the panorama in a large right turn then turn around higher up to retrace your steps (direction Cavallerie-Millau. Park in the car park, then head towards the signs and the metal railing, the descent is at the level of the description Boffi. On the plateau, the exit is on the east side.

From Millau take the direction of Roque Sainte Marguerite (Dourbie gorges), then in the village turn left towards Montpellier le vieux and follow the small road until you reach a bridge. Park before the bridge. We can check the landings on the climb. Take the path marked in yellow which leaves above the bridge (left bank). Reach the Roquesaltes plateau (30 minutes) passing under the large stone arch. Follow the sign “corniche de Rajol 0.8km” towards the south. At another junction follow “corniche de Rajol 0.4km”. Final part where you have to have a nose. Join the edge of the ledge on the right side by going down (easy) the yellow trace, then leaving the path on the left which passes under a small arch. Easily reach a large terrace on the opposite side (west side), the exit is at the end at the foot of a tree.

details.notes: Approximate location, really low
details.access: As the original exit was not very comfortable, a safer variant 20 meters to the left of it was found, with a start on a nice edge to guarantee easy pushing. Two pitons and a rope allow you to descend safely. Park nearby. Go down towards the field, crossing the small stream. Go up an animal path on the left to reach the plateau... the Exit is in a gap in the trees on the edge of the cliff..(Steep gully)

details.notes: Approximate location, Slightly overhanging cliff with relief which returns on the left and in the distance on the right. Possibility of taking a few momentum steps
details.access: From Montpellier take the N109 to Gignac then the D32 to Aniane. Then follow the Hérault gorges road to St Guilhem and park in the village. Follow the path at the exit of the village which leads to the Cirque de l'Infernet. Take the first path which goes up to the left at the foot of a small wall. 300 meters before the big wall, take the path on the left which reaches the top of the cliff. The spot is 200 meters from the trail to the west

details.notes: Approximate location
details.access: Coming from Bastia taking the N193 (T20) passing through Ponte Leccia and Francardo to arrive at Caporalino. Enter the village on the right as if going to the pizzeria then turn right again towards a recess which overlooks a bridge. Do not go further without 4x4! Cross the bridge and go straight up to the top on the right because even if the one on the left is higher I didn't find it jumpable! It takes 20/30 minutes to reach the summit for a mountaineer... From the summit you can see the village of Francardo!

details.notes: The LPO with whom we have very good relations in Aveyron asks us not to skip this exit between March 1 and September 30. Please respect this agreement.
details.access: 30 minutes on foot / Same access as for “Bikini Beach” from Massebiau. In the woods at the top, take the left fork, 15m before the one for Bikini. Follow the balcony path. When the path runs parallel to the Dourbie, spot a small block across the path then a stump with a big cut (if you arrive at a right turn with a view of the Delicatessen exit you have gone too far). Go down through the boxwoods along the axis with caution.

Park in Massebiau (parking at the entrance or on the beach side). Walk back through the village to the start of the path which runs along the cliffs towards Millau. Before arriving at the spot, climb off-path towards a gully which provides access to the summit plateau. 20 very dense, difficult meters (I haven't traced anything, it's wild!). Then cross horizontally towards Millau, the exit is on the second pillar towards the west. Static line in place. Small cade (juniper) just above to fix it plus a lunula in the rock at the edge of the void. Obvious placement at the side of the road (fields). Be careful of crops and electrical and telephone lines. Respect local residents.

details.notes: Location to specify
details.access: Arriving either from Millau or Nant, turn to reach Cantobre by crossing the Dourbie (1st bridge), then in a bend after a 2nd bridge (100m before Cantobre) park in a designated car park. From there, on foot go back down to the road and follow the yellow-red route (Catalan color) which starts at the metal railings. During the walk, at the exit of a passage along a wall, we can see the profile of the exit. After 25 to 30 minutes we arrive in a forest where large blue marks are painted on the pines. Continue the path which leaves the pine forest to gradually become flat (allow 5 to 8 minutes from the blue marks) and spot on the right side a small pine tree with a cairn (clearing). Reach the edge of the cliff (cairns) along an obvious pile of stones, the exit is under a large mushroom. Go down a small narrow corridor to reach the starting platform. There are 2 possibilities: either go running (positive for the first 10 meters) at the level of the boulder (1 bolt inside with abseil points lower), or go to the right to go down a small ledge (static line).

From Millau take the direction of Saint Geogres de Luzençon, then going downhill after the viaduct radar, turn right for Linas. Follow the road for 1km and park in a dirt space at the junction for Linas on the left in front of the “flood” barrier. On foot follow the track which passes above the small house until it becomes a shaded path which goes back due south. In an obvious clearing go down to the left, to easily cross the ravine of a stream, cross the field towards the north to reach the top of the cliff (hunter's dovecote cage on the site). Several exits possible, just find the right one where to attach the static line.

details.notes: Location to specify
details.access: 10 minutes on foot / The quickest way is to go up to the Brunas paragliding deco, then take the track on the right which passes the Viaduct viewing point, park in a field on the circus side when the cliff rises towards the antenna. Follow the Trail path which runs along the top of the wall and when it goes back 90° towards the south in the axis of the antenna in the distance, cross the fence to go to the characteristic exit on a diving board (small kairn). If you continue there is no more wall.

details.notes: Approximate location
details.access: From Nant, from the village center (square and park with plane trees) take the Pont de la Prade road in a small alley (rue Ernest André) and park before the equestrian center (do not block traffic). On foot, follow the yellow route (Roc Nantais) which runs alongside the equestrian center then follows a track. This track moves away from the rock towards the East. After 30 minutes, a path goes left into the embankment, still with a moderate slope towards the east. On the plateau, return to the West following Roc Nantais, an easy flat path. When you arrive at the Roc, at the end on the right side there are blocks to climb down very easily to reach the lower terrace. Obvious exit in a slight slope all the way to the feet.

At the exit of the village of Orpierre take a small makeshift bridge on the left to cross the river to reach a meadow. Attack the embankment by going around to the left while still having a view of the road. Follow the lines of scree near the cliff. The exit is to the right of a beautiful overhanging tree.

details.notes: The ideal location is located in a private garden belonging to very friendly English people who see no problem in spending time there :)
details.access: Same as for Le Puy de Thierry then continue to follow the cliff for 150 meters. The profile of the exit emerging in front of you.

details.notes: Location to specify
details.access: In 10 minutes on foot / The quickest is to go up by road to the plateau from the village of St Geniez De Bertrand or coming from Brunas and follow the D999 direction for 300m until a left turn, park there in front of the track (leave the way). Follow the fence in the woods on the right from the start of the track until an angle of 90° to the left. There cross the fence towards the edge of the cliff on the right (kairn) and go down towards the exit (traces). In 25 minutes on foot / from the dead-end road which leads to the cave, take a small path which leaves directly above the pillar and goes up to the plateau. At the gate, follow the fence into the woods towards the east (Millau), cross a small canyon then go up the slope to arrive above the piler (see previous description).

details.notes: Nesting regulations and order from March 15 to June 15. Sensitive sector during this period.
Nesting regulations and order from March 15 to June 15. Sensitive sector during this period.
details.access: From Millau, go up to the Puncho d'Agast plateau, go to the Paragliding decoration and park in the car park. Go around the antenna to the west and take the path which goes down on the left after the decoration towards the South for around 200m then follow the edge of the bar towards the East for around 600 meters. 5 minutes before arriving, you can see the slope of the cliff, which will make access to the exit quite obvious.

openedBy.name: Maxime Castagné , Maurice Mahieu and Carlos Torija Munoz

details.notes: watch out for NW, E, strong South wind... turbulent zone.
details.access: From Creissels, park in the Brunas paragliding parking lot. Follow the road on foot then take the “yellow” path in a left turn. Follow it (we cross the road once). At a hairpin on the right, where there is a sign with various signs, follow the narrow path which goes straight up, follow it for 70m and spot a cairn on the left before an oak tree. From there, descend following the well-marked trail to a first large stone step at the start of the wall. Do not follow the track which runs along the wall. Descend at 90° then 2m then go left and go down the embankment via a trace until you arrive at a horizontal trace which goes to the right into the forest. The exit is then at the large flat area on the left (cairn).

details.notes: Major place! The jump is just the end of a great ride. difficult access
details.access: In Orpierre, park at the Adrech car park with 2 options: Climb & base option, join the route Le dihedre sud 20 min walk, large route of 170 meters that you will not do entirely, there are 7 pitches in 5b/5c but you will stop at the 5th to directly reach the 2nd reminder of the large garden. The exit is there. Hiking option via Ascle, take the path towards Quiquillon. Arrived at the summit, mountain atmosphere guaranteed! Head towards the first rappel of the large garden (45 meters), crossing the ridges equipped with handrail cables. Once the abseil has been completed, you arrive on a terrace to take a second abseil. The exit is there. Start from the overhang on the left to avoid the ledge slightly below on the right.

details.notes: Approximate location
details.access: Park after Massebiau (about 1km max), either in the parking lot on the left side in a bend in the road to access the ruins of the castle, or after the source location on the right side of the road. Climb the embankment, cross diagonally to reach the foot of the first rock spur (there are two at the foot of the cliff). Cross a first small rocky bar on the left. Go back up towards the foot of the cliff facing you (zone of weakness with cone of scree). Cross a second small rocky bar (2m lock with shrub) which allows you to reach a ledge which you follow to the right to then go around a rocky spur, then go back up to the summit easily. Follow the wooded ridge towards the west (towards the castle and massebiau). The exit is marked with a cairn. If you find a “no hunting” sign at the edge of the cliff, you must retrace your steps 15m. Access to the exit is easy and wide to prepare for it.

details.notes: Location to specify
details.access: Park after the “no worries”, then go up by a path above the road leading towards the needle Climbing access route behind.

Park in the Vision area car park, access to dirt track (towards west, viaduct) from the Brunas paragliding deco. Follow the track for 50m after a bend and go down the tallus to reach a large platform on a pillar. The exit is there at the end (4 bolts in place).

details.notes: Very confined, but very aesthetic!!! Equipment suitable for this type of jump is highly recommended!!
details.access: Spot the jump carefully!! It is located on the left of the road at the entrance to the gorge when arriving from the North. From below, facing the rocks, it is to the left of the clearly identifiable arch. From the road, go around the jump on the left going up the screes. At the top, keep the gap on your right to reach the face. You will then have to carefully go down the slope to the exit located against a pillar which is on the left.

details.notes: Landing seems feasible but poor in finesse margins.
details.access: Coming from Senas, after passing the roundabout west of Mérindol (junction between D973 and D32), take the first road on the left and follow it until entering the valley (route de la font de l'orme ). In the valley, park at 43.76647, 5.197414. Follow the path until you reach small fields. Just climb the embankment from the last field.
