At the top, the exit is obvious on a step at the end of a gap in the bushes (made for the occasion).

details.notes: 36m in a face of approximately 50. The ledge advances approximately 6/7m. Proximity to trees during undercover.
details.access: Coming from Senas, after passing the roundabout west of Mérindol (junction between D973 and D32), take the first road on the left and follow it until entering the valley (route de la font de l'orme ). In the valley, park at 43.76647, 5.197414. Follow the path which leads to the foot of the jump. You just have to climb the embankment to reach it.

details.notes: 50m https://www.base-jump.org/topo/index.php?title=bon_dieu_de_bon_dieu
details.access: From Lourmarin center, drive towards Apt and, at the exit of the village, turn left onto Chemin du Pierrouret. We pass the wastewater treatment plant and garbage containers. About 1km after these, park at the side of the road (at 43.769291, 5.347224). Follow the GR 97 towards the north and, arriving in the valley behind the jump (approximately 43.769291, 5.347224), climb the slope through the vegetation until the gap. It is then easy to find a suitable exit. Cord present to indicate the original exit.

details.notes: Big slope with positive start. Be careful, there is little room to pass large trees for the garden installation if starting by hand. Also pay attention to the road which is very busy (and it goes fast) if you put an emergency vehicle or volunteer on it.
details.access: From the bottom of the jump, return to Lourmarin and take the first tarmac road on the left (around 600m after leaving the gorge). Go up the road until it becomes a track and park. Go up the path to the north and quickly turn left onto a path and follow it to the top. You will have to cross some vegetation once at the top to find an exit (several possible places, more or less positive).

In Robion center, pass to the left of the church and take the second right onto Chemin de Boulon Haut. Follow it, pass the large grass car park and park at the next car park which is under the jump. Walk back around for about 600m and take the path that goes right in the left turn going downhill. Follow it passing a first small gorge and once in the wooded part, continue for around 300m. Then head due west through the vegetation to reach the ridge and go down to the right on the rocky bars. Going to the end, we find an exit of approximately 50m, quite positive/vertical (the rest is higher and sloping but much less accessible, on a very steep slope).

details.notes: Jump discovered during This is not a frog , it is on the same side. But even if it is half as high, the access and exit make it much more aesthetic.
details.access: In Robion center, pass to the left of the church and take the second right onto Chemin de Boulon Haut. Follow it, pass the large grass car park and park at the next car park which is under the jump. Walk back for a few meters and, at a stone marker, start climbing the ridge through the vegetation to the entrance to a first small cave. We pass a first hole then we reach a second from the outside and we then crawl 10m in a tunnel which ends in the cavities where the exit is located.

details.notes: No jumping from mid-April to mid-June due to nesting!
details.access: From the 853m hairpin on the RD952, take the path which goes up the Brusc ravine to join the GR4. Follow it north to the “viewpoints”. Continue to follow the ridge towards the South-East until the cliff faces a 90° left turn and forms a beautiful pillar. The exit is there, slightly below. Descend carefully but without difficulty.

openedBy.name: Timothée Maurel , Eric Dambrine , Mic Veler and Yoann Kloess

details.access: Park (at 43.813565, 6.437970) in Clue de Chasteuil (10km after Castellane going towards La Palud). Instinctively climb the WEST ridge passing the different bars, scree, bushes...until the obvious exit in the shape of a very marked diving board. Some passages require good climbing skills.

details.notes: Pay attention to the different ski lift cables
details.access: Go to the Foux d'Allos station, from the central square, take the road which goes up towards the northwest of the station and the residences. Pass the cinema then large car parks. Park at the bottom of these (do not go up on the left towards the last residence). From here, walk on the track reserved for emergency services which starts from the back of the car park and which quickly goes left. Follow it until you reach a first cable car station and turn right at it. Then simply continue it to the foot of the needles, climb the embankment between them and climb on the right needle to the top. The exit is located under the summit (at the level of the stakes) on a small advance on which you will have to descend carefully.

details.notes: It is tempting to cut into the meadows on the approach step. This is strongly discouraged unless you have some knowledge of bullfighting or are comfortable with the idea of ​​facing a one-ton bull. A word to the wise! :)
details.access: From Saint Martin d'Entraunes, drive north towards Entraunes and park directly on the right after the Bramus tunnel. Continue on the road on foot for approximately 350m towards Entraunes and take the track on the left (the leftmost one, which goes south). Follow it and at the end of the first hairpin, it is possible to enter the edge to the left of the track to find a mini path. Following him, he passes through the middle of a farm. At this point, take the big track which goes up for around 200m and turn left at a meadow entrance. Do not enter the meadow, but follow the path that runs alongside it. You quickly arrive at a right turn which you should not follow by continuing to go straight (towards the south). From there, walk 500 to 600m in this direction and find the stream feeding the waterfall. Once done, follow it south. At the end, climb to the right so as to follow the top towards the southwest until you reach a ravine. You must now go down it (dangerous) until you reach the last ledge and once there, go back up towards the North-East. The exit is at 44.154116, 6.754637 (approximately 40m before the waterfall).

From Fréjus, take the coastal road towards Cannes and park in a car park under the rock of Saint-Barthélemy (en 43.444127, 6.903332). Continue on foot on the road towards Cannes, you pass a small bridge and in the next bend a climber's path on the left. Follow it until you reach the tarmac track higher up and follow it towards the EAST. The track turns 90° straight and a path climbs the embankment a little before. Go up until it intersects another path and turn left. The path will go up to the Cap Roux pass. Turn right at the pass to reach the rock where the exit is located on the south face (at 43.453072, 6.906086). Cairn at the exit.

details.notes: A rocky ramp is located approximately 20m in front of the jump and culminates approximately 50 meters below the exit.
details.access: From Saint-Rémy-de-Provence, go to the archaeological site of Glanum. Park on the right of the road at the site and continue on foot towards the South (Towards les Baux). A path starts a few dozen meters further on (the start of the path is a sort of low wall of stacked stones. Follow the path until you come across a cave, and go around it to the right to reach the ridge. Then simply rejoin the summit, just after a small cable on the ground.

details.notes: 50 meters, At the chapel, continue to follow the ridge towards the west until the obvious exit. (West facing part).
details.access: The two spots are located in the same cliff, close to each other and are described in order of opening. From Saou, enter the gorge and turn right on the bridge to leave the road which goes to Aouste. About 1.2 km after the bridge, park in the parking lot on the right. Cross the road and take the track following the signs for “Chapelle Saint-Médard”.

From Saou, take the direction of Crest (towards the WEST) and after the roundabout, take the first right towards Les Blaches. Drive on the path for about 700m and park near the start of the trail (about 150-200m) after a house). Follow the path which goes up through a V. At the top, it crosses another path which you will have to take towards the west. At the end of 200m, head due south through the forest until the gap and easily find the exit on a pillar where the cliff ends to become a sort of embankment.

In the center of Pont de Barret, take the direction of Féline. About 400m after leaving Pont-de-Barret, park at the first hairpin on the right. Walk about 500m on the path and turn left towards Eson bas. Follow Eson low and arrive at the level of the cliffs facing south, continue northwest to arrive at the exit (facing west on a cliff slightly detached from the rest). Obvious exit on a rock at the edge of the void.

details.notes: Several variants are possible in Static-line
details.access: From Bégude-de-Mazenc take the D540 and turn left towards Souspierre. About 400 meters after crossing the village, turn right following the purple painted rock indicating a Lavandin and Honey producer. Park on the edge of an uncultivated field and continue on foot on the GRP du Pays de Dieulefit. After passing in front of the pose then entering the forest continue on the GR then as soon as the path turns left (to reach Combe Oursière: IGN), find a path between the trees which reaches the summit on the left. Easily identifiable exit, at the most advanced place towards the landing where you can run.

details.notes: A little steep due to numerous ledges in the face which becomes positive on the lower part
details.access: From Eyzahut, via the D263, take the direction of Trou du Furet and continue the track to the quarry, or park 500 meters before at a hunter's house. This place is at the foot of the cliff in front of the scree. Join the quarry then go around it following the fence to take the path as far east as possible. A hundred meters further, turn left onto the path which follows the power line poles. A little higher, take the main path, but when it starts to descend, follow the rock on the left and make your way through the wave paths which join and follow the line of ridges. Continue to the top, where three rocks jut out into the void, the best start is on the middle one

From Joyeuse, on the D104, take the direction of “Le Freysinnet Paveyrol” towards the south and go up to Mas de La Bastide. Park in the visitors' car park. Pass through the gite subdivision then take the paths that go north up the hill. At the electric pole, leave the dirt road and go straight on the wide, sparse path. Leave the path at the hairpin on the left and move towards the void. Several Exits possible. Once installed, returning to the car on foot is possible in 40 minutes

details.notes: Extremely frequent thefts from the parking lot, do not leave any valuable items in vehicles.
details.access: From Buoux head towards the climbing sites, and park in the second car park. Go up on foot towards the fort, pay the entrance (5€) and follow the cobbled path which leads to it. The (obvious) departure is at the end, after crossing the ruins and at the level of a tree, facing North-East.

details.notes: Great running start
details.access: After the last climbers' parking lot, take the hiking path which begins behind the Seguins inn (it is preferable to go around it so as not to disturb the owners) and, after climbing onto the plateau, allows you to follow the ridge and reach at the top of the pillar where the start is located.

details.notes: Sensitive area because it is a very popular climbing site. Do not throw stones because the routes below are often full of climbers. Do not hesitate to warn climbers in person before the jump. The jumps are very tight, so the opening really hits them in the ears, not to mention the visuals... This is a priori the first jump in the Vosges massif since the appearance of the base. If this massif took a long time before appearing on the map it is not for nothing. Even if the panorama is magnificent, this jump remains a very challenging jump. The margins are low, the visual is very aggressive and the leap is technical.
details.access: From Mulhouse, take the D430 (almost to the end) until you arrive at the Charlemagne car park on the Route des Crêtes. Then follow a marked trail for 5 to 10 minutes towards Martinswand. Go down the Martinswand exit road on the left to find yourself between the small Matterhorn (on the right) and the Martinswand (on the left). At this moment the climbing part begins. Which can be free solo over 7 m or assured by the equipped route over around fifteen meters. In all cases it is strongly recommended to be 2 people, including at least one good climber (even if not a base climber). The exit is quite obvious, at the top.

details.notes: Jump engaged with a pushing axis strictly identical to the red arrow in the image. Left and right orientations should be corrected very quickly with the controls. You have to aim for a +5 at 25m to be good in terms of margins. With the same way a sail which starts to fly between 25 and 30m. The main difference with Dark Piggy is that it is a bit less recessed, and that it has between 1 and 2 m more vertical margins.
details.access: Instead of climbing the Martinswand on the left, you have to climb the small Matterhorn on the right. Be careful at this stage it's necessarily free soloing for around 7m with a potential fall of around twenty meters in the event of a miss...

details.notes: Sensitive area because it is a climbing site, a nature reserve and not far from the Tanet ski slopes., Tree at 30m (mastery of SL flight between 25 /30m)
details.access: From the Col de la Schlucht take the D 61 towards Lac Blanc for around 2 km. After coming across a small car park, take the path which leads to the Tanet rock (Gr5). The exit is in the northern part of the Rock, slightly below the path.

locations.name: Tout Wa bien Doux jésus,merci Marie

details.access: From Saint-Gervais-sur-Mare, take the direction of Lacaune, 10km after the village, on the right are the cliffs, continue towards Brusque-Camarès on the d53, and turn right Le Fau and park there . From there, continue the road heading east on foot. Then head straight across the field(s), and shortly before arriving at the end of the field(s), turn left and look for a small hunter's path, continue it for less than 100m and head as well that badly in the direction of the exit (obvious), the return is made by a small path (some blue mark) at the level of the landing.

locations.name: Sôt soit celui qui pense que six saucisses ne font ni six Saussois ni six Saucissons (Soit tu fais tes sauts soit tu te tais sot !)

details.notes: This jump takes place below the Garde Grosse Paragliding decoration. Outside their operating zone, but nevertheless the presence of climbers cannot be excluded. Beautiful view of the Rocher de l'Aiguille and Nyons in the background.
details.access: From Nyons take the D94 towards Rémuzat. After the tunnel take the first right and go up towards Le Col Lacroix then continue to go up towards the Leisure Centre, up to the St Rimbert sign and turn right. At the next intersection, turn left and park at the end of the road. Continue on foot on the wide path until you pass the land on the edge of the orchard. Continue to the right for about fifty meters then take a path at a clearing on the left, which leads to a path leading to the summit. Shortly after views appear, find a path that descends onto the wide ledge below. Cord in place on the root of the base of a tree, several exits possible.

details.notes: Finesse 2 to reach the landing to the North
details.access: From Nyons take the D94 towards Rémuzat. After the tunnel take the first right and go up towards Le Col Lacroix then continue to go up and park at the Leisure Center. Take the middle path which goes up along the ridges towards the North for around 1700 meters. The exit is opposite a woodcut in the forest on the slope

From Mollans-sur-Ouvèze or La Carrière, go to Hameau-de-la-Garigue. Take the stony track which leads into the woods for 1 kilometer. At the foot of the antenna, a marked path runs more or less along the edge of the cliff, following it for a distance of around 200 meters. Reach the edge of the cliff to arrive on a small terrace with a dead shrub stump. This place is ideal for tackling the cliff and throwing stones but it is not the best vertical! (Shrubs in the face). We can see on the right a ledge with a characteristic point which juts out into the void. Retrace your steps a few meters and go down the latter to finally go around a shrub and reach this point (a few branches have been cut). Push towards the quarry to benefit from the slight slope of the face. (the jump is vertical)

details.notes: Above the olive trees in the heart of the Baronnies Provençales, magnificent view at the top of the Rocher de Saint-Julien with Mont Ventoux in the background!
details.access: From Buis-les-Baronnies follow the D546 north towards the Gorges d'Ubrieux and park in the small car park at the climbing site. Retrace your steps on the road for 1.1 kilometers then around fifty meters after the Buis-les-Baronnies entrance sign, turn left on the track which passes through the olive trees in front of the Aiguille de Buis to join the botanical trail ( always on the left). After passing the Jas du Blanc, continue on the path to a viewpoint from where you can see the cliff of the Montlaud mountain. Then turn left and reach the summit (Château d'Ubrieux). A large pile of stones with a small flag symbolizes it. The cliff being slightly positive, the best vertical is located in the axis of the seal behind the flag towards the void (small slope in the opening zone). A good run-up and powerful push is recommended.

From the village of Cornillac (26), continue the D557 towards the East and at the fork turn right towards Le Serre. Always right towards the Serre at the next intersection, until crossing the last large farm after which the road is no longer paved, continue to go straight up the Chemin de Saint Ginies and park at the Saint Ginies chapel. From there, continue the path straight towards the Raton ridge. The track will begin to wind through the forest and head southwest for a long time before turning into a path that will lead to the top of the ridge. Once at the top, go back up towards the north east following the ridge via the Pas de la Pousterle for a little over 2.5km until arriving at the edge of the cliff.

From Serres in the Hautes Alpes, go up to Sigotier, then to Piarre and finally to the hamlet of Château and park there. From the D27 which goes up to the Col de Carabès, take the forest track which goes to the right immediately after the hamlet. Go approximately 700m and turn right at the intersection. About 50m later, before the left turn, leave the track and go right into the forest. From there, walk more or less straight on for 450m towards the edge of the cliff already visible, there are some not obvious traces, otherwise through woods and bushes, there is a small thalweg to cross. Arriving at the edge, you quickly reach the exit on a small white roof visible from below, at the western end of the cliff.

details.notes: - Do not neglect the 3 steps of momentum offered by the slab to start, because positive jump - Like the entire Saint May / Rémuzat sector, a significant jump because raptors have been reintroduced and although there is no official ban on our practice, some do not view it very favorably. Discretion required .
details.access: On the D570 going up to Léoux from Villeperdrix, about 100m after the first house, take the path on foot which goes left at the corner of the fire hydrant, signposted Col de Pierre Blanche. The path will quickly emerge onto a track, at the first fork where you can observe the jump from below taking a right to go around the face. Then at the next intersection, turn left to climb and gain a foothold on the ridge. Once at the top, follow the ridge towards the south for around 400m until you reach a white slab which allows you to take 3 steps.

details.notes: Something to rappel down (rope in place)
details.access: From the flat of Sainte Luce with a ruin of Chappelle we can see the exit very well in profile. From there, without going too far towards the east, pass along the northern slope of the mountain at the level of a very small scree, and reach towards the north a trace between the two rocky bars by an easy de-escalation through the boxwoods (nothing very obvious). once between the two rocky bars, go about 400 meters towards the west then just before arriving on the last flat and at the level of a manhole in the left bar, climb the ridge a little later in order to find the two abseils above the exit of approximately 15m each (rope in place).

details.notes: watch out for aerology depending on the season
many possible exits on both sides of the mountain!
Difficult jump with extractor by hand, a left orientation would be very bad. No problem with static line.
details.access: From the point, climb after the pass and the hamlet “Le Gros”. Take the forest road on the left and stay left. After a few km follow a bad road after the houses, turn left again. There is a path for climbers that leads to the base and top of the cliff. The exit is very far to the left in a dihedral just before a very positive wall.

details.notes: Original exit at the highest point despite a beautiful coping below to the right and left. Axis of the jump towards the North-East, centered on the beach, confinement required. (you will understand why :))
details.access: From the Colle-sur-Loup stadium follow the D6 towards the South-West for approximately 1.8km until the entrance to a quarry. (43.680107, 7.079621). From there, take the track heading towards the East/South-East and follow it for around 800m to the cabin (indication St.pomp. on the IGN map). From the cabin, continue 200m in the same direction and take a path on the left. You will then have to play with the paths by pulling as far as possible to the left in order to reach the exit at 43.68, 7.079491. Obvious exit on beautiful steps with rope in place.

details.notes: It is possible to jump from the highest (around 65m) but the top is positive. The pillar described above is, for its part, very comfortable. It can be nice and profitable to bring a bike and a theft lock, to pedal from the parking lot to the landing, to go up on foot and then pedal back.
details.access: From Fréjus, take the coastal road towards Cannes. In Agay, turn left on the D100 and follow it for 1.6km. Turn right to go towards the Esterel massif and drive towards the Col de Belle Barbe. Once at the pass, continue straight ahead until the barrier and park here (43.458107, 6.866049) a little before the Gratadis bridge.  Walk on the track towards the North-West and turn left at the Col du Mistral. This will take you back down into the valley where the Perthus bridge is located. (you are here at the pose level). Cross the bridge and turn left for 250m and take the path which goes up on the right. 150m further on, turn left to go west, then straight on at the next crow's foot. Then just follow the path to the summit. At the top and facing the void, go down to the right onto a very obvious 45m pillar overhanging. Presence of a climbing anchor.

Arriving at Saint-Anne d'Evenos from the south, park as you enter the village. Take the first road on the left and follow it for approximately 200m. Turn left on the track and follow it for around 400m until you reach a right turn. Here a climber's path starts on the left of the road. Then simply follow it until you reach the summit on the south face, at the climbing equipment level.

Park on the side of the road at the stop (at 43.176223, 5.845815) then continue on foot on the road towards the North-East. At the right turn, continue on the track towards the North-East until you reach the ridge. There, you will have to turn left on the climbers' path and follow it as best you can until the exit (43.177522, 5.845414) using the blue markings. Tip: At one point, the trail leaves the southeast direction. It is therefore preferable to stay the course rather than follow the path, even if the vegetation is dense (blue markings are always present).

details.notes: Significant overhang in the upper part but the same cannot be said of the second half.
details.access: From Lauzet center and going towards Barcelonette, turn left 150m before the gendarmerie and follow the road (it crosses the Ubaye then winds quite steeply) up to 44.444563, 6.421808 and park on the side of the road. From there, walk continuing on the road to the hamlet of Champ Contier. Follow the hiking trail heading towards the North-East at the top of the Hamlet. The one will then cross the watercourse and go up to the top of the rock where the exit is located (Parual indication on the IGN map). At the top and facing the gap, go down to the right until you reach the exit, a small obvious slab after an area of ​​trees

Arriving from the west and towards Barcelonnette, turn right at the La Fresquière exit towards the ecomuseum and take the track along the Ubay without crossing it. Park at 44.400111, 6.518102. Walk up towards La Fresquière, cross the D900 and continue straight on the small road which goes up to the hamlet of Méans. In the hamlet, cross the field to reach the highest gîte on the edge of the woods and pick up a path (which appears on the IGN) which goes up to the summit. At the summit, reach the right part of the south face where there is the exit marked by a tree and a climbing rope.

details.notes: Running off
details.access: Park in Scaffarels. Cross the bridge towards the south and take the path directly to the left with the barrier (which goes up to an agricultural equipment warehouse). A path begins above the warehouse (difficult to find, use the IGN map), once found, follow it to the top via the Ravin d'Educh. Leaving this ravine, cut towards the North-West to reach the left end of the North face where the rocks are located. The exit is obvious on the larger of the two rocks (the one on the left when you are at the top facing the void). A cairn marks the exact location.

From Patrimonio, take the D333 towards Farinole. Park at the first hairpin before changing sides. Take the hunter's path which runs along the ridge line for 10 minutes before reaching the characteristic overhanging rock.

details.notes: Hunters.
details.access: Park either in the village (extends the access time a little), or on one of the widenings of the forest track which goes up to the right of the massif from Soula. Following the vehicle track you arrive at a first Y with a hiking path which goes up to the left into the forest, follow it. At the second Y, turn left. At the third junction (X) at a clearing, left again. At the fourth crossroads (Y) left again, then continue towards the ridge crossing the forest. We pass through a wooded basin then once at the crest, go left to the highest point of the forest. Then locate access to the exit between a block and a small tree. An easier exit is located 10 to 15m to the west.

details.notes: do not purge anything, the access road to the cave is just below.
details.access: Park in the cave car park, go down the road a little and quite quickly you find a gully which rises alternating between trees and scree. Make the wild boar and catch up with the ridge on the left until you identify the exit which allows you to jump while keeping the entrance to the cave on your right. Possible variants nearby.

details.notes: Perhaps a sensitive cliff following the major landslides in the village a few years ago, let's remain discreet.
details.access: Park in one of the car parks facing the exit, then go up the road/path towards the Col d'Ussat (we cross Barry-d'En-Haut), exit taking a fairly flat path which takes us back in the direction of the exit. The exit is opposite the “Hôtel Thermal du Parc”.

From Ollioules, take the D2020 to go up to Gros Cerveau (road closed in summer). Park at 43.15782, 5.805712 in the cistern car park (about 400m after passing the barrier of the track which goes up to the fort). Walk east along the cliff following the path. The Exit is marked by a small cairn, around 30m before arriving at the belvedere, at the level of an old climbing plateau.

Go to Chateaudouble via the D54 via Figanière (southern access via the D955 is cut off). Cross the village and continue west on the D51. About 3km after the village, park on the side of the road at 43.6037, 6.419851. Walk on the path going south and maintain this heading in order to find the exit at 43.59175, 6.416172 via the small climbers' paths (not indicated on the map). Place directly on the projection on the left. This allows you to then trudge back up to the exit and return to the car via the same path as the outward route.

From Fréjus, take the coastal road towards Cannes and park in a car park under the rock of Saint-Barthélemy (en 43.444127, 6.903332). Continue on foot on the road towards Cannes, you pass a small bridge and in the next bend a climber's path on the left. Follow it until you reach the tarmac track higher up and follow it towards the EAST. Cross the track and immediately take the path that leaves in the middle of the bend and follow it until the first crossroads (Col du Saint-Pilon). Turn right to return to the EAST and, further on the path, another path goes left and goes around Saint-Pilon, going left to its summit. Once at the top, you will have to go down to the exit (see arrow in the photo) by descending slightly.

details.notes: There is a ledge on the left 35m below.
details.access: From Gourdon, take the direction of Gréolière and park in the car park (at 43.739427, 6.995569) 800m after the lavender fields and the belvedere. From there, head due EAST into the forest to reach the void, go down one or two rocky bars and head due SOUTH towards the obvious exit (at 43.738671, 6.997682).

From Comps sur Artuby, take the D955 towards Castellane. In the small village of Jabron, turn right after the bridge and continue on the road until 43.751757, 6.50901 and park. Cross the river and take the track which goes up towards the estate. Do not go as far as the gate, but turn left about 100m before reaching a rubble dumping area. From here, climb up the cliff through the vegetation to the exit (several possible between 40 and 45m).

Park in Robion or le petit Robion and take one of the marked trails leading up to the chapel and visible on the IGN map. Arrive below the chapel, do not climb there and take the slope on the left in order to go up the scree and access the ledge overlooking the chapel (easy climb). Once on the ledge, the exit is very obvious and comfortable, on an advance slightly offset to the left in relation to the chapel.

From Gémenos, take the D2 towards Plan d'Aups and park at 43.299613, 5.660597 in the hairpin bend. Follow the track until you pass behind the massif and take the path on the right at 43.300696, 5.652925 (in the bend where there is a circular concrete slab and a conch shell). Go up until you cross the top of the Galère breach (43.305566, 5.656222) and go down to the right in the vegetation to reach the exit (43.304549, 5.657764). Even if it is tempting to go towards the EAST, the exit is in the western part of the face, almost in the gap, in an area that is a little more open than elsewhere. A bush is located just under the start.

From Serres, take the Grenoble road towards the North for approximately 2km and park at the antenna before the V, at 44.44271, 5.714938. Cross the road then the railway to climb the embankment to a correct exit (locating from below allows you to easily estimate the position of the exits on the bar).

details.notes: Wild boar access, locate the cliff on the map.
details.access: Park at the Nances cemetery. Take the path going up the mountain towards the South towards the Grotte de la Conche and Les Balmes. When the path changes direction to head north, walk another 300m, until approximately 45.582532, 5.807321. From there, go left into the vegetation towards the North-West to find the edge of the cliff and an exit which was cleared with a saw, at approximately 45.583196, 5.805237.

details.notes: WS jump, Tape at 5s. Start low in a gorge for WS.
details.access: From the town center of Rioupéroux (le posa) take direction Séchilienne, then Col de Luitel and then Chamrousse, and finally right at the Chamrousse 1600 sign. Park in the cross-country ski trail car park at the end of the road. Cross the cross-country ski trails (Plateau de l'Arselle) in the middle, heading towards the right-hand track. Follow it for around 150m then turn left onto a path which goes down slightly.

openedBy.name: Philippe Jean , Vincent Descols , Mathieu Leroux and Maël Baguet

details.notes: Despite the height of the jump on the north side, the small size of the landing, the traffic on the road, and the presence of the river, encourages more to do a static line. Moreover, if starting by hand, a 90° right is really not recommended (on the left it's the same in fact)
details.access: For both, the easiest is to park the car on the south side. For the north jump, take the path at the start of the car park which goes up towards the bois redon and on the left when you arrive at the road, after leaving the house on your left, go up a small path on the left until you reach at the exit (obvious) cord for static line in place. For the south jump, take the bungee jump access path, jump from the platform.

details.notes: Despite the height of the jump on the north side, the small size of the landing, the traffic on the road, and the presence of the river, encourages more to do a static line. Moreover, if starting by hand, a 90° right is really not recommended (on the left it's the same in fact).
details.access: For both, the easiest is to park the car on the south side. For the north jump, take the path at the start of the car park which goes up towards the bois redon and on the left when you arrive at the road, after leaving the house on your left, go up a small path on the left until you reach at the exit (obvious) cord for static line in place. For the south jump, take the bungee jump access path, jump from the platform.

details.notes: The via ferrata is chargeable.
details.access: From the 8 to eight supermarket, go up to the via ferrata hut , then take the path which goes to the via north face (not marked on the beginning).

From Bédeillac take the direction of Saurat by the D618, 800m after leaving the village of Bédéillac, take the small track on the left which goes up to the hamlet of Sescal and leave the car there, retrace your steps and take the small path on the left to the IGN altimeter markers 670, then climb as straight as possible to the exit (42.870986, 1.552885 location to be confirmed)

details.notes: 3 anchor points (with straps and rope in very poor condition) are located in the axis of the jump, it is possible to install a rope there to check its verticality.
details.access: From the village of Troubat, go up to the cliff (follow the signs), once at the foot of the cliff park the car, when you look at the cliff from below, go up to the right.

Go to the landing place which is located at the exit of the village, at the foot of the cliff in the Marignac axis => Saint-Béat on the D44, to climb it to the Tour de Marignac (indication sign in the center of the village ), 20m before arriving at the foot of the tower, head due east until you reach a tree where the cord for the static line is located.

From Cierp, go up to the Waterloo source (IGN info), then go up the old access path which goes to the old mine, once you arrive at this go up another 15m and head due east to reach the exit . Carefully check the axis of the jump.

details.notes: Due to the presence of Bearded Vultures, the practice of climbing is regulated and base jumping is not yet regulated, however it is preferable to only jump outside the nesting period (September - October)
details.access: From the town center of Cier de Luchon go to the parking lot of the Mail de Jorc climbing site (42.850101, 0.597484), take the path heading south for 200m (the climb is from the left when you look at the face from below) , then go straight up the slope for a good 30 minutes until reaching the first conifers, then head clearly to the edge of the cliff, and go back down until you find a correct exit.

details.notes: maybe possible for WS
details.access: From Galié towards Saint Béat, 2km before Saint-Béat, leave the N125 for the D44f towards Eup and Bezins-Garraux. Cross the village of Eup, and continue straight towards Bezins. At the next fork take the road on the right, cross Bezins and park in the small car park in front of the church. From there take the most direct path which goes up to Pic Saillant and which passes through the Col de Teyech. Once arrived at the cross, go down South/South-East for 20m until reaching the vertical of the valley (obvious) Exit 3 stars.

From La Garde, head EAST and park at 43.829426, 6.563258 when leaving the village. Take the track going up to Chapelle St-Martin. Arriving there, follow the path going up to the foot of the cliff. Once underneath, go around the cliff via the path on the left or the scree slopes on the right. In both cases, part of the access is done instinctively through the vegetation. Arriving at the top, look for an exit in one of the beautiful, very straight breaks.

From Etsaut, take the small asphalt road from Larres to the hamlet of Casadepats (42.917126, -0.569578), after walking 150m on the track not authorized for vehicles (East-SE) to the metal gate, take the small path uphill left in the woods towards the North up to the Col de Coundre, then go back down clearly to the exit. Climbing belay to hang the static line.

details.notes: A jump without much interest, in a rather nice setting.
details.access: From Bagnères-de-Bigorre go up to the Col des Palomières, once at the pass take the first track on the right which goes to Bernadaus (ign map) (43.043142, 0.197522), at the end of the road go up to the Lhéris helmet via the most direct path (5km distance), from the summit go down 20 to 30m towards east then south, to reach the jump (43.013402,0.231295)

details.notes: The jump is visible when you take the D9 from Fougax-et-Barrineuf towards Montsègur. Access to the jump passes through the castles, the visit is paying, check the visiting times.
details.access: Go to the castles, cross them, then head due east to reach the edge of the massif.

details.notes: No restrictions, but not far from Roc de Séjour where there is a Biotope. It is a popular climbing rock, caution for falling rocks do not scare climbers.
details.access: Park in the Contrac village car park and follow the path to the summit of Roche Ronde. Left side looking down, near the stone wall. A rope is in place to make it a static-line.

From Lourdes towards Gavarnie on the d821, take the Agos-Vidalos exit and immediately right Carrière du Pibeste on the d921b, then the 1st left in the activity zone until you arrive at a large field which is parking office (43.044558, -0.063344), then climb through the vegetation via the ridge to the exit (43.045024, -0.070645).

details.notes: The jump is above a railway line, so you have to fly above the catenaries.
details.access: From Donzère take the D486 towards Viviers. Park at the parking lot at the entrance to the Pont du Robinet. Locate the jump point from the bottom, then head back towards Donzère on foot. Just after passing under the railway line, turn left onto the service road. Before the gate on the right, take a small path which winds up to the top. Arriving on the slab, follow the edge of the cliff for around 150 meters, quickly after having gone along the fenced part, the exit is behind a small grove of trees.

n Donzère find the path to Beauvert. Just after the last house take the small path which goes off to the left into the woods. At every crossroads, always turn left. We will arrive at the top of the parade fairly quickly. Or make the access to Pont du Robinet , and instead of stopping there, continue naturally to the summit. The exit seems quite obvious. Big run-up possible and recommended

From the Pont du Robinet, take the small road which runs along the west bank of the Rhône towards the north for 2 kilometers. The cliff is on the left. About 500 meters further, a hiking trail leads to the statue of St. Michael at the top of Mt. Several departures possible.

details.notes: Another fixed rope can be useful for descending an inclined plane in the forest on the descent path (but really not obligatory). Departure from the top made by Vincent Cotte on 02/10/2022, the summit to the right of the red arrow in the photo. a little harder start but avoid the very rotten descent for the classic exit.
details.access: Go up towards L’Alpe d’Huez. Arriving in Huez, turn left towards Villard-Reculas. Park in the hairpin at “Pas de la Confession”. Follow the road on foot for approximately 100m. A hole in the concrete parapet allows you to take a path going down. Follow it to the edge of the cliff, then pull right going down. You will find the exit in the gorge. A fixed rope is in place.

details.notes: Evacuation jump carried out in degraded conditions. There is surely something better to find than a static-line.
details.access: From Digne les Bains, drive towards the village of Dourbes, cross the village and park at the bend at 44.061111, 6.315076. Continue the road, walking for 200m and take the path on the left. Follow the paths towards Pas de Labaud, and once at the top, head north until you reach the first bar and find a safe exit.

From Trescléoux, continue westwards for approximately 2.5km and park next to the start of the trail at 44.352556, 5.680097. Take the path towards the North to go up the valley. It will then go up towards the West to join a track. simply follow it towards the south and exit when it goes north again in order to cross the vegetation and reach the south-facing cliff at approximately 44.356998, 5.679661. Several possible exits: Comfortable but less vertical all the way to the EAST, and positive at the top but more sloping approximately in the middle of the face.

From Trescléoux, continue westwards for approximately 2.5km and park next to the start of the trail at 44.352556, 5.680097. Take the path towards the North to go up the valley and turn right 250m further on to pass to the other side of the valley. Follow the path (see IGN map) to the top of the Aumage rocks and find the exit at approximately 44.355574, 5.693961. The path may have disappeared a little during the climb, rely on your sense of direction and climbing :)

details.notes: It goes without saying that access via the footbridge is prohibited!!
details.access: Coming from Nice on the M6202 heading north, turn right towards Saint Sauveur de Tinée and park near the quarry, at 43.930671, 7.178914. You must discreetly reach the footbridge crossing the Tinée and once on the other side, follow the river towards the northwest. You will quickly be forced to enter the vegetation, which you will have to cross until you reach a sort of large recess (at 43.930126, 7.183361). At this point, climb to the right in the embankment to reach the ledge overlooking the Tinée, then find the exit a little further on (approximately at 43.931381, 7.181146). Identifying the exit and the access opposite will facilitate your progress, which is however not complicated.

From Guillaume, take the direction of Péone, drive about 4 km and park at 44.106074, 6.895294. The road passes under the jump just before. From the parking lot climb the embankment towards the southwest. Do not try to climb to the highest level, stay on the first floor. 200m further on, we come across the obvious point from which we can leave and reach it carefully. the exit is located slightly below next to a bush. (Cordelette probably still in place to spot it).

From Dieulefit, take the D538 towards the town of Roche-Saint-Secret-Béconne and turn left at a place called Tanville (see IGN map). Go up the road to the large field and park. Continue to climb the road on foot and turn right to cross the stream in front of the barrier then cross it to continue on the path which goes up to the Col de Bonnardel. Once at the top, at the foot of the La Charousse embankment, climb over a small fence again on the left to follow the path towards the north which climbs to the left of the jump, then return naturally to the point where the exit is obvious. Return to the car via the same route.

openedBy.name: Maxime Castagné , Pierre Lebreton and Timothée Maurel

details.notes: Dangerous positioning, do not slip.
details.access: From Beauvezer, cross the Verdon by the bridge and drive towards Villars Heyssier, cross the village then go to the end of the track to the car park at 44.125402, 6.613318. Follow the GR Tour du Haut Verdon, do not take the bridge at 44.122386, 6.636631 and go up to the top of the Serre de l'Aï crest. Once on the ridge, follow it due west until the gap. You will have to go down several ledges, then a very steep slope made up of steps in order to approach the exit (approximately at 44.125999, 6.618474).

details.notes: Really nice and quick spot. Possibility of landing on the track after flying in the clue.
details.access: From the center of Tartonne, take the track heading North-West towards the Clue de la Peine for 3km and park at 44.088231, 6.389261 just before the small bridge. On foot, cross the bridge and take the track directly to the right until you reach the clue. Before passing the clue, climb the slope on the left to the exit at 44.096974, 6.392034 (via a sort of small pit between two rocks).

details.notes: Positive jump (around -20 +4), into the protective net.
details.access: Park near the bunker (around 44.072476, 6.85667). On foot, walk north and turn left before the Roberts Bridge. Take the path going up then to the left 50m further (around 44.075863, 6.857172) and follow it until the exit (around 44.071133, 6.855556).

details.notes: Same side as ¡Olé! , but much safer and different access. It is tempting to cut into the meadows on the approach step. This is strongly discouraged unless you have some knowledge of bullfighting or are comfortable with the idea of ​​facing a one-ton bull. A word to the wise! :)
details.access: From Saint Martin d'Entraunes, drive north towards Entraunes and park directly on the right after the Bramus tunnel. Continue on the road on foot for approximately 350m towards Entraunes and take the track on the left (the leftmost one, which goes south). Follow it and at the end of the first hairpin, it is possible to enter the edge to the left of the track to find a mini path. Following him, he passes through the middle of a farm. At this point, take the big track which goes up for around 200m and turn left at a meadow entrance. Do not enter the meadow, but follow the path that runs alongside it. You quickly arrive at a right turn which you should not follow by continuing to go straight (towards the south). Arriving around 44.155994, 6.754815, leave the path and cross the vegetation towards the West-South-West, remaining on the top of the ridge. Arriving at the gap, turn left to look for possibilities of going down to the ledge below then follow it towards the south until the exit on a pointed rock (approximately at 44.155269, 6.75653).

Go to the village of Rigaud in the Cians gorges and park at the cemetery. Go up by the road which goes furthest to the left of it. Arriving on the plateau, pass the houses that breed dogs, after the drinking water fountain a private road leaves on the left. Follow him while remaining discreet. Around 43.974205, 6.998488 leave the path towards the east and cross the dense vegetation towards the exit, around 43.975625, 7.003191 (progress not easy).

From Tende, take the road going to Granges de la Pia via Vallon du Réfrei and park at approximately 44.115727, 7.617391 before the hamlet. Walk following the main track going to Granges de la Pia then find the hiking trail going up to Castel Tournou. Arriving under the jump, go up to the right and easily reach the edge where several exits are possible.

details.notes: BE CAREFUL, veer below to the left at the exit of the track hairpin, maximum height 100m. Once on the slope, you will have to trudge in order to reach the path descending from Castel Tournou towards the Granges de la Pia.
details.access: From Tende, take the road going to Granges de la Pia via Vallon du Réfrei and park at approximately 44.106587, 7.613158. At the car park, take the track going up to the right then the hiking trail on the left a little further on. This goes up to the obvious exit at the hairpin at 44.120907, 7.628473.

From Tende, drive south and turn left at 44.067912, 7.59908 to take the Lubayre road. Follow it almost to the antenna and park around 44.067932, 7.598969. From there, reach the antenna, then the edge of the void just below and a correct exit with climbing relays around 44.065778, 7.599472 on a slab.

Park in Tende and walk to the cemetery at 44.08588, 7.592302 (next to the small ruined tower). Follow the path from the cemetery towards the via ferrata and follow the Chapelle Saint-Sauveur. Once on the crest, equip yourself to take the via ferrata in the opposite direction on the footbridge then to the right in order to reach the very aerial part where you will find an exit.

From the center of the village of Tautavel take the d9 towards Estagel, after crossing the river le Verdouble continue for another 500m and park the car at the restaurant Le petit gris, take the small road below the restaurant parking lot towards the indication IGN el Priorat (42.811621, 2.736846), at the end of the path there is a small path (not marked on the ign map) on the left, which goes up to a cross, once at the cross go down due east for 200 or 300m until 'to find the exit.

From Perpignan, go to Rivesaltes then continue to Vingrau and park the car there, from the center of the village take the hiking path due north in the direction (ign indication) of Planal de l'Eixartell and Correc dels Collets on 1.4km, leave the path when it goes to the right towards the thalweg, then go due north for 300m to 400m to reach the edge of the cliff (exit: 42.862639, 2.785758).
From Saint-Pierre-la-Mer, head towards Fleury via the D1118 and park in the - Oeil Doux car park. Reach the upper part of the cliff (obvious).
Park in the car park at 44.457877, 4.444499. join the river, cross it and go up, going around the rock to the left (or perhaps also the right). Several obvious exits.
Park in the car park at 44.460921, 4.444163. Climb through the vegetation towards the obvious exit.

Park in the car park at 44.472036, 4.349276 west of Pradons. Follow the path towards the north which passes through the small hamlet, leave it to pass through the vegetation and climb to the top of the cliffs. Several possible exits to 44.477143, 4.345623.

From Perpignan, go to Rivesaltes then continue towards Vingrau. Coming from Rivesaltes, there is a first parking lot 100 meters on the left below the road (picnic area, parking for climbers). Then go up the road for 500m and take the hiking path on the left which goes due north towards the summit. After the jump it is possible to go to the refuge and do Bugnator.

details.notes: Slightly positive wall on the first meters and small jump under the exit! Static Line not recommended
details.access: From Saint-Martin-d'Ardèche follow the D290 towards the Gorges tourist route and stop at the first belvedere. Go down on the small ledge that you can see from it. The exit is on the right. Push into the axis of the rock protruding below. Once placed, go up the course of the Ardèche on the left bank for

details.notes: Overhanging wall but a little steep
details.access: From Aiguèze Follow the GR4 for approximately 2.5 kilometers, and turn right onto a path indicating Les Rochers de Castelviel. Continue until you reach the side of the cliff then go down to the right on the ledge full of shrubs, the Exit and about ten meters on the left.

From the D86 which passes through the center of Cruas, take the direction of Saint-Vincent-de-Barrès. Around two hundred meters after leaving the village, park and take the path which goes up on the left. Before landing take the path on the right for around fifty meters and climb into the thickets (steep) more or less along the edge of the cliff. The exit is located at the place where the “nose” advances the furthest over the void.

details.notes: Cliff with 7/8 meters of slope and 6 comfortable pitches. There is also another jump about 30 meters to the left of the exit, much lower but very pretty and overhanging.
details.access: From Meyrueis take the D986 towards the west. After about 7km, park alongside a forest on the left of the road. From the parking lot walk about 15/20 minutes downhill. Continue in the forest for around 200m, then go down as best as possible into the valley on the left, return to the right after a small cirque, find a comfortable terrace to equip yourself.

details.notes: The exit is located at the arrival of the via ferrata, in line with the belay cable. The wall is very overhanging. A good run-up is possible, but be careful not to trip! (PJ). A variant has been opened on the right side facing the village, where flying under sail to Florac is possible.
details.access: From Florac take the direction of the Aerodrome and go up to the Col de la Pierre Plate via the D16. As soon as you arrive on the plateau, park in the first parking lot on the right. Follow the path in front of the car park which goes up to the antenna, then follow the cliff. We quickly see the “cap” on the left. Continue to follow the path, then a well-marked path on the left, which will take you to the finish of the via ferrata.

openedBy.name: Philippe Bermon , Lewis Jones , Cyprien Revaux , Burim Shala , Tom Davies , Kieren Hopper and Tomasz Liepec

details.notes: A rocky jump in the axis of the exit requires a fairly quick control, but not too much!
details.access: From Nyons, go to Propiac, then take the D347 towards the North for 4.7 kilometers. At the height of the house at the foot of the mountain where the Chapelle Saint-Jean d'Ollon is located, a submersible bridge allows you to cross the river. Continue on the track and park at 44.315373, 5.187802 . Take the track on foot which then winds into the mountain. After passing the cliff which forms the ridge line, a path on the left allows you to easily climb the spur on the north side. Once at the summit, continue following the ridge towards the South until the exit which faces East.

From Roche-Saint-Secret-Béconne take the D538 towards Dieulefit for 5 kilometers, and turn right at a place called Tanville (see IGN map). Go up the road to the large field and park. The jump is visible to the Northeast. Retrace your steps on the road and turn right onto the machine track. Once in front of small rocky bars, climb them and join the path which leads quickly to the top where the characteristic exit is obvious.

From Dieulefit go to the Village Huttopia Dieulefit campsite and park in the car park. Take the track which goes into the woods to the north until the Carrefour des Réservoirs, turn right towards the Carrefour Les Quatre Chemins where you will continue on the track on the left. About 50 meters further take a path on the left which joins a path and climbs the Montagne de Saint-Maurice towards the north. This path catches up with and cuts the track which goes up to the summit twice. At the last hairpin, continue following the ridges. Arriving at the level of the jump, go past it until you find a place to go down onto the ledge below then return along the rocky bar through the boxwood to access the pillar. Exit facing north, marked with a Cairn, above an embankment on the right.

details.notes: Splendid view of the Alps, Mont Ventoux, Tricastin, the Ardèche Valley, Mont Lozère...
details.access: From Saint-Remèze follow the D362 for three kilometers towards Larnas and just before the hamlet Les Hellys, turn left towards Dent de Rez. Park near the place called Reynouard shortly before the Col d'Eyrol, join it and take the path on the right to reach the summit. Continue east. Exit near the Orientation table

details.notes: Attention landing zone concerning the landing zone on the rails, I had confirmation that the trains leaving the tunnel could drive at 80km/h... This LZ must remain secondary. Keep in mind that if, ultimately, the presence of a train is felt on the track, it is a thousand times better to end up in the water (this was my plan B) than on the track.
details.access: Take the D1 and park in Laifour. Cross the bridge (railway) and head south for about 50 meters until you find a small gap in the woods. Climb to the exit while keeping the “empty” right handrail. The main exit is about ten meters lower than the summit. There is the presence of a small blue marking on the grid.

details.notes: Sensitive area because the installation area is in an urban area near a busy road.
details.access: By autonav, from Revin, go up rue George SAND to the parking lot with the Faligeotte rock viewpoint. Park there and head (continue up the road) to the first of the 2 visible antennas. At the sign (viewpoint 160m away, steep path) follow the path until you reach the first antenna. 5 m before arriving at the antenna, turn right into a small wood which leads to the small ledge where the exit is located.

details.notes: Sensitive area causes Biodiversity and Wild Goats. The landing zone is quite steep (even if it remains generous), so check the aerological conditions carefully. Thanks to the wild goats for the traced trail.
details.access: By autonav, from Remouchamps, take the direction of Sougné and go up the Trotinfosse road. At the end of the road, turn left and go up a path to a small parking space (Sign: Falaises de Falizes). From this parking continue on foot uphill towards the Heide de Gâtes, simply follow the track while maintaining the left handrail of the cliff. Be careful at one point the track becomes narrow and the crossing with wild goats is possible (Gâtes). After tens of meters go under a fence (twice) to access the Exit. This one is oriented SOUTH EAST and marked by a small tree (where a strap for the static should be in place)

Two options are available to you. 1: From the village of Furfooz go down the rue des Aiguilles de Chaleux on foot or by car (path and parking difficult) to an obvious track which goes into the woods and leads to the needles. 2: Go to the end of Chemin de Chaleux (Hulsonniaux) and park at the end of it. Cross the Lesse (be careful of the water level) and climb the track towards the needles. Arriving at the needles (they are divided into 3 teeth) take the direction of the middle one, the main exit is at the end.

locations.name: Pas de PCA, pas de chocolat !

details.notes: Sensitive/prohibited area (like all E in Belgium). Discretion and respect for the premises must be the golden rule, especially since access is close to homes.
details.access: Go up rue de Loyers (Lives-sur-meuse) until you reach the last house in the woods (around 600m). Then take the small track on the left for about a hundred meters which leads to the jump zone. The exit is immediately to the left, 2 meters higher, forming the break with the large promontory. To access the track leading to the Exit, you can either park your car next to the private car park (in a small area), or park in Lives-les-Meuse and walk uphill.

details.notes: The main exit is the one in the middle, it is the best compromise between rock drop/landing area/incidents/nuisance. Sensitive area because of a nature reserve and proximity to homes/road traffic.
details.access: By autonav, park in the large car park at the entrance to Saint Adrien (coming from Rouen) and head towards the city center. After about a hundred meters take a small track on the left which goes up through the buildings. After 3 to 5 minutes turn left towards the rocks and the valley which leads to Rouen. The main exit is on the middle rock (there are 3 possible rocks).

locations.name: Si tu changes 4 lettres à Marc, ça fait bite !

details.notes: Sensitive area because of a nature reserve and proximity to homes/road traffic... It is also a very popular climbing site... So be careful not to scare them and especially not throwing stones.
details.access: By autonav, simply park in the small parking lot leading to the climbing routes and go up the slopes to reach the top of the cliff (it climbs well). Arriving at the top, simply follow the track for a hundred meters (level line) and head towards the Roche de l'Ermite (according to IGN map). 5 meters before the highest point we come across holes in the rock, this indicates that we are on the right rock (approximately in the center of the Ermite rock). You just have to continue climbing for around ten meters to arrive on the promontory. The main exit is on the left. The main exit is oriented to the left (Southeast trend), because it offers the best compromise during an incident to find an emergency landing. In the corner a lot of exits are skipped, but this one with this orientation remains the one which gives the most margins/easiness to pose. Be careful there is a micro bend on the right (keeping a thrust axis in the direction of the large field is the good option)

details.notes: More technical jump than it seems. Firstly the height, 45m without the height of the trees does not allow for any opening errors. Slightly overhanging vertical wall. Area with strong turbulence if there is wind (morning or evening jump). Be careful in thermal areas too and disgusting at the end of the day at sunset. Having a good idea of ​​Puncho aerology can help. Urban area with homes, busy road and numerous airlines.
details.access: From the climb to Puncho d'Agast from Millau, in the last left turn under the cliffs, park in a location which allows you to reach the Hibou cave. Follow the path without entering the cave, follow the cliff then go up into a very wide gully where the path winds to go on the right side towards the ledge. Follow the cornice path towards the south (Millau on the left) until you reach a clear flat area with a protective rope (the exit is opposite), then continue uphill to go around the ravine and when the path becomes flat again, spot continued on the right a cairn at the foot of a large oak tree. Go down, the exit is 20m away at the edge of the void on a small detached pillar.

From the Hôtel Bowling in Millau take the first right at the Puech d'Andan roundabout, then the first right towards Solanes. Drive two kilometers, park two hundred meters before the Solanes gite and take a wide path which goes up along a field. Leave it at the hairpin on the right, staying on a small path which winds up to the top. Arriving at the fields on the Puech plateau, continue left into the woods then go down right to reach the exit.

openedBy.name: Maxime Castagné , Ion-Mihael Paquet and Maurice Mahieu

details.notes: Jump whose interest is the passage through the arch under sail, the landing is then technical in the valley of the man or the screes. Otherwise set the course without passing through the arch. The exit was opened in static-line due to poor hardware adjustment but is certainly possible by hand despite the confinement in the lower left part.
details.access: Pure wild boar, easy to spot from the road!! Park around 44.451017, 5.454712 and go down into the forest towards the west in order to cross the stream and go up the Combe de l'homme. Then, go up a large scree to reach the arch. Once arrived under it, turn left towards the west to find a very steep thalweg which it is possible to go up (engaged in wet conditions). Once at the top, progress towards the north to find an exit towards 44.452954, 5.449818 (uncertain coordinates).

details.notes: Good quality hiking base. Be careful, the landing requires good piloting skills, spot a landing at the bottom just in case.
details.access: From Laruns, head towards Artouste to the small village of Eaux Chaudes. About 250m after leaving the village, take the small road which goes up on the left before the bridge. Follow it, it turns into a track and park as far away as possible. (en 42.944459, -0.438689) when opening. Then follow the GRP Tour de la Vallée d'Ossau (see IGN) to the high point at 42.944459, -0.438689. From there go down North-West towards the void and one of the possible exits around 42.957138, -0.430169 (see photo).

From Lescun, head towards the Abérouat refuge and park near the start of the hiking trail at 42.94658, -0.661274. Follow the hiking trail heading east to Cuyalar du boué (buoy hut). Once arrived there, go up the scree towards the North-West to reach a small pass then follow the ridge towards the East until the exit (positive in the upper part) at approximately 42.962239, -0.649078.

details.notes: A very profitable low slider: No walking with a 10 min shuttle, 4 star exit 3 or 4 steps, full slope, very correct height, steep embankment, placed close to the car, long and covered with a layer of fine cushioning gravel. PS: We love you Magalie!!! Thank you for this gift!
details.access: From Clamensane, drive east and park a car in the large car park at the foot of the jump at 44.318555, 6.100814. With another car (or on foot), continue the road 500m until the small bridge on the right, cross it and continue until 44.308705, 6.108364 where you must take the track on the right. Follow it to the first hairpin on the left and park there (44.316361, 6.102631). Head northwest into the forest for 60m to find the obvious exit, marked by side markings made of stones.

Park under the jump towards 44.473405, 4.335082. Walk on the road towards the North then take the path on the left just after the bend. Climb into the pine forest at the top and turn left towards the east when the path goes west (at 44.47523, 4.331017). Follow the path until the gap and one of the possible exits (at the HT line or on the right).

details.notes: you might reach the beach, you might not.
details.access: Park in the car park at 44.475831, 4.351225. Continue the path until 44.477256, 4.349102 where we find a beautiful slab below, above the ean. Possibility of skipping Isla Cool Doux in order to cross the Ardèche for the first time, then bend and climb to the exit, jump to cross again and return to the car. (see access to Isla Cool Sweet )

details.notes: The Aye site has 3 eagle areas listed in the cliff. The eagles nested there in 2019: on this occasion the young eaglet was equipped with a GPS beacon as part of a CNRS study. The female of this pair is also equipped with a GPS. During nesting, the site is particularly sensitive until the eaglet flies away, which generally occurs at the beginning of August. If nesting is in progress, it will be noted here, please respect the tranquility of the area! Before jumping into this corner, check here if it's all good or not. THANKS
details.access: From Chateauroux, go to Serre Buzard. Before the hamlet, take the concrete track on the left and follow it (it turns into an unpaved track). Park at 44.656379, 6.536535 and follow the track heading south. Then simply follow the path up to the Saint-Pierre chapel and the Alpet cabin. Once you have reached the chapel, join the ridge on the right about halfway up to the right of a dead tree and find the magnificent over-obvious exit. (somewhere around 44.657593, 6.522036) Once landed, return from the track towards the South-East until the intersection where the car is parked. (approximately 20 mins)

details.notes: Avoid jumping between mid-March and the end of July. This nest may not be there depending on the years. Do not hesitate to inquire at the Maison du Parc de l’Embrunais (+33 492 432 331)
details.access: From Châteauroux les Alpes head towards the Pisse waterfall and park in the car park before the Parc des Ecrins barrier (be careful, narrow road). Take the path that goes up to the top of the waterfall (and not the one that leads to the foot of the waterfall), you then pass right under the spot. Continue the path up to the distroit valley then cross the torrent on the right just at a small waterfall. You then have to go straight up the slope, going around the big bars to the right until the end. Then go straight again on the slope to the bottom of the valley, then go diagonally to the right until you can reach the ridge on the right. We then go down this stop to arrive directly at the spot, obvious exit. Do not throw stones on the hiking trail just under the exit. A rope is in place (2017 / 2023 Edit: rope still in place);

details.notes: beach/perfect river after a day of climbing

details.access: From Roche-Saint-Secret-Béconne, take the D538 towards Dieulefit. As soon as you leave the town of Roche-Saint-Secret, drive 3700 meters to the camping area and turn left towards the Col de la Ruche, then park next to the fields in front of the jump. Walk on the road which crosses the river and climbs to the foot of the embankment. Take the path on the left for a few hundred meters, then climb the embankment to the right (not really a path, there is no point in going up to the top) to reach a large ledge against a rocky ledge, the exit is located just below it behind some small shrubs.

details.notes: it is necessary to fly above the catenaries to access the landing
details.access: From Donzère take the D486 towards Viviers and park in the car park at the entrance to Pont-du-Robinet. Return on foot to the road towards Donzère. Just after passing under the railway line, turn left onto the service road. Before the gate on the right, take a small path which winds up to the top. Arriving on the slab, stay on the path which runs along the parade for 1200 meters. Shortly before arriving, the pillar is visible on the left. Pass over the ridge towards the West which joins it. Two exits possible, one on the face of the pillar facing North, and the other on the one facing South.

Take route C-14 towards Seu d’Urgell, past Coll de Nargó and before reaching Organyá take route L-401 (crossing the d’Espia bridge) in the direction of Alinyá. After passing the first curve (from here you can see an orange cave) you will find a sidetrack on the right where you park the car. If you don’t get too lost its an hour to the exit. By foot continue up the same road looking for the start of a ridge that comes down from the top of the cave. You will see the first piece of the ridge, but don’t take it, take the superior one. Between the small part of the ridge and a path that goes down to the river there is (more or less) a path used by climbers. Use the ridge that goes to the top of the cave as a good reference point. Once you get this ridge, access to the exit is a semi-climb that’s easy with good hand holds on the rock.
details.notes: Very overhanging.

details.access: After Noves de Segre we will drive towards Guàrdia d'Ares. Before entering the canyon, we will park our first car in a little parking area on the side of the road. With a second car we will keep driving a few more kilometres until we find another parking area just on top of the exit. After Noves de Segre we will drive towards Guàrdia d'Ares. Before entering the canyon, we will park our first car in a little parking area on the side of the road. With a second car we will keep driving a few more kilometres until we find another parking area just on top of the exit.
details.notes: Very fun canopy traffic so you can play with the terrain. Pay attention with the power lines. There is one in the landing and another one while under canopy to the right.

details.access: Past Oliana and in the direction of Coll de Nargó, a few kilometers from Coll de Nargó, in the section of tunnels that are next to the reservoir, park on the secondary road that heads right just before entering the tunnel with construction buildings. Follow the path that climbers use to descend from the Bucólica wall, which will take you to the top of this one. Then follow the edge on the left to the end until you come across the next wall, flanking it on the right thru various scree slopes. When the wall ends, trailblaze from there through the edge of the second wall until you reach the exit.
details.notes: Although it may seem like a handheld jump, it is preferable to jump it static line, given the oreography of the slope and the verticality of the jump.

openedBy.name: Rich, Jose Rodríguez Algayer, Ceci Aguirre and David Fusté

details.access: Use the parking used by people accessing the via ferrata “Regina”. We will climb the via ferrata “Regina” to the top of the big spire, right before a suspension bridge. From there we abseil down 10 meters (or not so easy climbing down) to get to the cliff . We abseil down again 20 meters to get to a very confortable ledge with the exit point.
details.notes: First abseil can be done by down climbing. Second one alread has a rope (it may be necessary to replace it for a new rope). Be careful with the weird wings of the area during the landing. You can also jump from the top without abseiling.

openedBy.name: Mireia Miró and David Fusté, with help from Ceci Aguirre

details.access: Park at the Can Boix Restaurante, between the villages of Peramola and Oliana. The jump is visible right in front. From Can Boix take the path towards the Sant Honorat mountains. After passing the narrow pass, leave the path and start heading upward to the right in the direction of the exit. From this point there is no trail, look for the easiest path. About 45 minutes, with some easy rock scrambles.
details.notes: there is a rope at the exit. Be careful with 90 degree off heading either way. Respect the Can Boix restaurant private property, don’t drive into the private enclosures nor make any loud noises while landing.

details.access: Leaving Pobla de Segur towards Sort on route N-260, before reaching the first tunnel you will see the old road to the right. Park the vehicle where it will not impede your landing. Use the descent path the climbers use, it is well marked and equipped with ropes and chains. It starts about 300m to the left of the landing area. The exit is at the top of the central minaret.
details.notes: Parking is prohibited on this part of the road; if you must leave a vehicle unattended, leave it at Font de la Figuereta, 300m before the tunnel on the right.

openedBy.name: Richi Navarro, Óscar Cacho and Turko Ortiz

details.access: From Pobla de Segur towards Sort on route N-260, park at Font de la Figuereta, 300m before the tunnel on the right. another option is to park at the climber return trailhead which will take you toe the top of the wall. The problem is there is no room for vehicles. From Font de la Figuereta, hike (about 1km) using the old road avoiding the tunnel until you reach the small parking lot at the trailhead, unless you park there. The path is very well marked. A good reference is the electrical towers that you head towards. When you get to the towers take the path that goes SW towards a canal that’s equipped with chains (the ferrata). It will take you to the top; follow the path along the edge until you reach the stone marked exit. It’s a mini ramp
details.notes: Jump is slightly overhung that tends towards vertical at the bottom. Be careful of the high power lines (the ones you will see on the hike up), you will pass over them with plenty of altitude, but keep them in mind.

details.access: The same as for Kalimera. The electrical towers are a good reference, head towards them. Just before you reach them, start looking for the wall’s edge via a light descent towards the right.
details.notes: A small length of rope is recommended to go down to the exit. This is an overhung exit with little room for error on landing.

details.access: From Camarasa go in the direction of Tremp. Park at the exit of the tunnel that crosses over the Camarasa dam. There are parking lots on both sides of the road. Hike up and over the tunnel following a small path that skirts the right side of the wall (facing it). At your own convenience, leave the path and head towards the top of the wall. The exit is more than obvious and incredible, because it is consists of a large round stone that juts out of from the face of the wall.
details.notes: Vertical jump with a good landing, but on the road. Be cautious and watch for traffic.

details.access: Two options (two vehicles are a waste of time): - Without driver: From Áger head towards Coll d’Ares (paraglider launch site). A few kilometers after leaving Áger and almost reaching the pass, you’ll find an intersection on the left on a tight turn that veers right. Continue on this road, where you will quickly reach another intersection and turn right. Follow this road until the end, directly below the jump and park. - With driver: Head towards Coll d’Ares and take the road to the observatory. The road continues, but is very rough. With a 4x4 you can reach the top of the exit. From there the path is well marked with stones. There is a down climbing rope next to the exit (about 5’). The walk takes 1 hour or if you’re dropped off the driver can pick you up at the landing site (Plana del Lluis). From Plana del Lluis: Look for a small road that exits the parking lot (to the right of the meadow, looking that the wall) and follow it staying on the right. It will take you to a small channel which will take you to the top near the exit, marked with a stone, where you will find an old affixed rope you can use to look over the edge. - From the observatory: Continue to the road until you find a very large stone marker, this is where you descend down a level so you can skirt the wall to the right (same as if you ascend from Plana del Lluis)
details.notes: Vertical jump (overhung after passing a ceiling half way down the wall) with perfect landing. 2 second delay puts you below the ceiling.

openedBy.name: Emilio De Bricio and Richi Navarro

details.access: From the parking lot at the Font de les Bagasses walk along route C-13 in the direction of Tremp. 100 meters past km 71, head up along a canal on the right side of the road, climbing over metallic fences along the road. Continue on the canal until you reach the first stone plaza. Contine along the canal to a seond stone plaza. From there leave the canal in a diagonal direction upwards and to the right until you reach the exit.
details.notes: Overhung exit with a good landing.

details.access: From the Montalegre path take the trail that goes underneath the Mont-Roig BASE jump until you get to the refugio del Búho. (appro. 1 hour taking your time). From the refugio take the path that is evident up to the wall of the cliff, where you will head left, always keeping the wall to your right (NE direction, Tremp) in about 10’ you will be at the Pared dels Sostres (wall of Sostres). You must head to the lower levels being that the exit isn’t at the top. Just before the last climb down there is a stone marker (this is where you gear up). A small platform and you are at the exit
details.notes: Overhung exit with good landing.

openedBy.name: Richi Navarro and Óscar Cacho, Juanjo Medina

details.access: Approach the top of the wall from the right (facing the wall). Approximately 30 minutes.
