details.notes: A short 5 meter rope in case the rope in the exit for the static jump is too old. In case of not reaching the landing, we have the path below as plan B.

openedBy.name: Ceci Aguirre, Richi Navarro and David Fusté

details.access: Without driver about 35’: take the road to Montalegre, just before a vehicle intersection there is a trailhead (marked in yellow in the photo) that shortcuts the trail, in minutes you will reach a trail on the left that the climbers use on their return from the vías, continue straight on the marked trail heading NW atop the road that is parallel to your left. After about 100m before the end of the trail (ending at Montalegre) on the left marked by a stone there is a path that will take you to Cilindre as you pass by the other exit Sanllor. You can’t get lost and in a few minutes you are at the highest point. - With driver about 10’: Begin at the trailhead and in about 100m on the right, (marked in red in the photo) continue the climbers path to the top.
details.notes: Overhung jump and tight landing. Be careful of vehicles (from atop you can see if vehicles are approaching) and with two tensor cables the landing area is limited.

openedBy.name: Richi Navarro, Oscar Cacho and Turko Ortiz

details.access: Park at the landing site and hike up to the top along the right side of the wall (facing it).
details.notes: 20 meters below Pina Mona. Be careful, not all fields are landable. You should land in any field not surrounded by fences.

details.access: To not get lost, look for the edge of wall and walk until you find a large stone that marks the exit. In any case, if you have a good idea of where you are going, you can head towards the wall further ahead to avoid making lots of turns. There are stone markers from the last prairie where you leave the vehicle to the exit.
details.notes: At the base of the wall, to the right, there is a clearing surrounded by trees. There is a 40-degree inclination and lots of large boulders. Recommend wearing ankle support.

details.access: Approach the top of the wall from the right (facing the wall). Approximately 30 minutes
details.notes: Slightly overhung and good landing.

details.access: Take the path that takes you up to Cogulló, and about half way up, at the same level as the wall, head right on an unmarked trail and look for the exit. Approximately 30 minutes.
details.notes: vertical jump with a good landing. Don't waste altitude during canopy ride or you won't make it to the landing.

details.access: 1h 30 '(about 3.5 km). From the end of the track we will start a well-marked path (yellow marks) making a very characteristic step to the top. We will follow North direction to the few meters we will leave the footpath by the left direction the West (There is a landmark signaling the intersection) There is not a very defined footpath but the passage of the cattle has been defining it, there we will head towards the ridge.The Exit is signposted with a large landmark.The vertical of the jump is orange.
details.notes: Semi-overhung jump with good landing.

details.access: From the parking lot there is a well stone marked trail that leads to the top along the left side of the wall (facing it). There is a short rope attached to a bolt to gain access to the exit (you can descend to the exit step without the rope), very close to the climbing route called escalada Amadeus.
details.notes: take a short 3 meter rope in case the climb down to the exit is not obvious. Vertical jump with a tight landing.

details.access: Park at the landing site and hike up to the top along the right side of the wall (facing it).
details.notes: Be careful, not all fields are landable. You should land in any field not surrounded by fences.

details.access: From the parking lot there is a well stone marked trail that leads to the top along the left side of the wall (facing it). You have to keep going along the wall until you get to a second wall, right at the edge, to the right of a tree you will find the exit. Approximately 40 minutes.
details.notes: Slightly overhung jump with a good landing.

openedBy.name: Mireia Miró, Turko Ortiz and David Fusté

details.access: With driver: 2 minutes form the path. - Without driver: Start at the town and parallel to the road in the direction of Artesa there is a path that is somewhat marked but evident that it takes you up to the antenna. (There is a shortcut that’s a bit wild but fast 45’). From the antenna to the exit is about 5’. The exit is about 10 meters down; there is a small one person shelf. Climb down from the left of the exit, it’s easy. (Gear up before the climb down). A good reference is a small bush that’s a little down to the left and some large rocks in an open area (jump over them).
details.notes: Be careful with the wall to the left in the case of off-heading openings. It isn’t necessary, but if you want to feel more comfortable with the climb down to the exit, bring 15m of rope.

openedBy.name: Richi Navarro, Franc Navarro and Anotonio Roque

details.access: Ascend thru a canal between the climbing areas of a Herbolari and Siuranella. Once at the top of the canal, go right on a poorly marked trail going up thru some rocks. From there take the obvious route that borders the wall until you reach a spot above the exit point. The exit point is located by climbing down 5 meters, you will find a triangular shaped rock.
details.notes: Be careful of the power lines in the landing area.

details.access: Park at the side of the road. About 200 meters after crossing a bridge below a large ceiling, you can reach the top using a climber descent path (located on the northeast slope of the wall). Once on the edge of the wall, before reaching the center peak, you must skirt a long turn a few meters below the peak. When you get midway across the wall, directly in the middle of the vertical wall (near the end of the climbing route called Fase Terminal), you will find a single bolt (don’t confuse this one with bolts where climbing routes unite on the same turn). From this bolt you will rappel down 30 meters to the exit platform.
details.notes: Rope is there, but it may be in bad conditions.

details.access: 2 minute walk from the access road to the exit (You can’t miss the exit point, there is a rock in the form of a diving board).
details.notes: It is advised to shuttle a second vehicle or have a non-jumping driver. The road from Chía to Pared del Sol is not good for normal vehicles (preferably 4x4 or high clearance vehicles). Be careful with the wind, landing is quite far.

details.access: Ascend the left side of the wall following the terrain. There is no trail.
details.notes: BASE Jumping is prohibited in this area during certain seasons of the year. Please, check current regulations before jumping.

details.access: Once parked, continue on foot up to the end of the road, where you will find a small clearing. This is the landing area. From there take small path to the left in the direction of the wall, where you will flank the wall to the left and continuing towards the exit point taking a via ferrata.
details.notes: Vertical wall that is positive to the left. Precision landing is necessary.

details.access: Take a goat trail from the town of Benaocaz. 1h traverse on a gentle slope with some wide open areas. When you get to the last section, instead of following the signs to the left, continue straight leaving the highest peak to your left (photo 1). Ascend the field with a 130-165ft (40-50m) incline, until you get to the top, always leaving the highest peak to your left (photo 2) – standing at the exit looking left.
details.notes: It is highly recommended that you walk the landing site before jumping, because it’s technical and there is little margin for error.

details.access: Hike towards the mountain and ascend up a ditch that is very visible towards the right.
details.notes: There are several positive shelves at the exit. We tied a rope to a tree to get down several meters and later retrieved it.

details.access: Easily following the wall from the right (30min).
details.notes: Nice overhang and easy landing

details.access: Parking is on the roadside at the widest point next to the river valley. Use as a reference an abandoned mine next to a vertical limestone wall that’s on the other side of the railroad track. Cross the river. There is no bridge, but you can usually cross over on a fallen tree. At a later time, cross the train track (be careful, there is a blind curve) and hop a livestock fence (there are feral goats all over). The area may be private or part of a park because of the fence. All of the approach is a walk up.
details.notes: 0 meter (33ft) rappelling rope recommended, unless you are familiar with the exit.

details.access: Use the El Mirador restaurant parking lot. Hike towards the caminito del rey trail, then take the right fork that takes you up to the exit (40min).
details.notes: There are other exits nearby, but with less altitude to impact. Tight landing. Wind currents are common thru the canyons. Verify good landing conditions below.

details.access: Hike up until you are more or less below the exit. From there take a path that traverses the wall to the left. There is some scrambling required but no climbing gear necessary. Once atop, follow the crest to the right and you will find the exit point.
details.notes: The upper part of the wall is overhung, but about 50m down there are some positive shelves. Keep that in mind. There are also some positive ridges to the left that are close. 90o off heading to the left is not recommended.

details.access: Begin at the trail (among many of the choices which are well marked with stones). The ascent is easy. In about 2 hours (or a little over an hour using the shortcut) you will arrive at the open area of Castillo Mayor (it is a large prairie) and from here the exit is about 30 minutes.
details.notes: It is advised to shuttle a second vehicle or have a non-jumping driver. Jump is also wingsuitable. In that case, landing is in the fields at the end of the valley, and we will need a good glide flight.

details.access: From the pass we take the path to the south
details.notes: In a small field next to the road and where you park.

openedBy.name: Richi Navarro, Turko Ortiz, Óscar Cacho and Mireia Miró

details.access: When you are at the edge of the cliff, go towards the left and use the first vehicle as a reference to the approach to the exit. There is a stone marker at the exit; it is very visible on a rock that protrudes like a diving board
details.notes: Overhung exit and good landing.

openedBy.name: Richi Navarro, Franc Navarro and Robert

details.access: Walk along the edge in an easterly direction from the antennas, and at about 15/20’ you will see a second peel below which is where you want to be (easy down climb, no rope necessary). The exit is in the form of a diving board.
details.notes: The road to the antennas is not very good. Recommend a high clearance vehicle or 4x4.

details.access: You can get there using the the Ferrata or its return path thats easier and no extra gear is needed. Its a good trail and it gets you to the top of the peak in a little over an hour. Once on top (where there is a return down the Ferrata) head to the right and north. The trial is more or less marked, or it is evident as the path is worn. It runs down close to the cliff. In about 30’ you will reach the exit.
details.notes: You have to commit with a hand held exit due to the wall becoming positive. But the canopy flight is amazing; a ramp in the future could make it interesting.

details.access: The same as for Franc, except when you get to the Franc exit, continue along the wall’s edge until you get to the Cafè David exit.
details.notes: Incredible canopy ride. Committed in wingsuit.

details.access: Same as Franc. you'd pass by the exit 15 minutes before arriving to Franc.
details.notes: Large overhung with technical exit.

details.access: From the refugio del Buho it takes about 15’ heading in a (NE) direction,and always keeping the wall face to your right. The exit is lower than the trail (by about 5m), in the form of a balcony and is obvious.
details.notes: Slightly overhung exit with a magnificent canopy flight and good landing.

openedBy.name: Richi Navarro and Emilio De Bricio

details.access: From the vehicle take the forest road until you get to a ravine that extends down from the shoulder of the jump. You can traverse the ravine (climb in some parts of it), but towards the end it gets steep and has loose rock. In about 1h30’ you will arrive at the exit marked by stone. There is an affixed rope to help you climb down.
details.notes: BASE Jumping is prohibited in this area during certain seasons of the year. Please, check current regulations before jumping. Be careful in the final approach on the shoulder.

details.access: 1h15’/1h30’ Tha same as Palomera, but once you arrive at the top of the shoulder, go left. A good reference is to look for the highest level of the mountain. From there, descend to the cliff edge. (gear up before the descent) There is an affixed rope to help get to the exit.
details.notes: BASE Jumping is prohibited in this area during certain seasons of the year. Please, check current regulations before jumping.

openedBy.name: Richi Navarro, Oscar Cacho, Turko Ortiz, Luís Alonso, Luís Manzaneda and Pau Pineda

details.access: From the vehicle head SE via a path that is somewhat marked all the way to the exit. (It is an easy 5-minute walk). The exit is obvious, it’s equipped with rope and there are various platforms to choose from.
details.notes: Jump is a large overhang and a bad landing.

openedBy.name: Enrique Pastor, Siscu, Carlos, Juanjo and Hubert

details.access: The same as Aragón exit, except you will find the exit a few meters into the descent to Aragón. The exit is a large nose that sticks out over the vertical wall. There is a small stone marking a small climb down to the exit.
details.notes: Very large overhung exit at the start and more vertical towards the bottom. Spectacular canopy flight in front of the Aragón wall.

openedBy.name: Richi Navarro and Emilio de Bricio

details.notes: opened while filming a Shell commercial for TV.

openedBy.name: Hubert Shober, Frank and Daniel Hernán

details.access: The same as Catalunya jump, but you will find the exit, marked by stone, way before.
details.notes: Be careful of low pulls if you intend to land in Mas Carlets. With a southerly wind you will not reach it and the only alternative is a tree landing. The Mas Carlets refuge has a fountain. If the water level of the dam is more than 38% there is no landing, it is recommended that you land in Mas Carlets.

openedBy.name: Enrique Pastor, Jordi Canals, Carlos Escobar and Albrecht

details.access: The same as for Torre Roja, except you need to trek a few more minutes along the edge of the wall and climb up a small ledge to the exit, located at the top of a spire.
details.notes: Extreme wingsuit jump. Positive about 200ft down and gentle slope to the landing.

details.access: Take the path towards Grau de Salflores, it is well marked. Once you pass steel steps, follow the path to the right; it will ascend to el Grau. At the highest point of the trail, head NW, you will hike to another part of the mountain (there is an visible path along the mountain range). From here you should see the exit in the form of a nose, high ceiling with orange colored lower part. Head towards the top of the nose. The exit will be below and an easy climb down. There is a climbing plate on the back wall of the exit. The exit is directly to the right or climb down a little to the left.
details.notes: Very large overhang, nice canopy ride and tight landing. Caution! do not land in surrounding fields, there are vineyards with hanging barbed wire, dangerous for you and your canopy.

details.access: The path is indicated and obvious. The first part of the path is cement and later cobblestones. You will find a fork where going right will take you to the top of Falconera (a good reference will be that you will be able to see Falconera from the path the whole time) using a channel that goes up and to the left. The path will be indicated with red and white markings as well as stones. Once at the top of Falconera the exit will be a little to the right, looking down to the the landing area (there is a wall to the lower left, be careful of off-heading openings in that direction, as the wall is very close).
details.notes: BASE Jumping is prohibited in this area during certain seasons of the year. Please, check current regulations before jumping.

openedBy.name: David Guti, Richi Navarro, Óscar Cacho and Turko Ortiz

details.access: From the car, after passing a fence on the road, take a well marked path at the base of the mountain until you have a direct path towards the hill to the left of the exit point peak. This path will take you there. You arrive in about 45’. The exit is will marked with stone.
details.notes: BASE Jumping is prohibited in this area during certain seasons of the year. Please, check current regulations before jumping.

openedBy.name: Richi Navarro, Oscar Cacho, Turko Ortiz, Luís Alonso, Luís Manzaneda and Pau Pineda

details.access: Take the path to the right of the wall (looking at the wall), taking the Sant Jeroni channel. Once in the pass, take the path the left which will take you to the Sant Jeroni antennas, where you will jump over a gate to gain access to a spectacular exit. The exact location of the exit is marked by attached ropes.
details.notes: Vertical jump. Mainly for big wingsuits. BASE Jumping is prohibited in this area during certain seasons of the year. Please, check current regulations before jumping.

details.access: From can Massana head towards refugio de Agulles, up the “les Bessones” channel until reaching the north face, there is a small climb to the “Miranda dels Ossos” peak. 1h 15min.
details.notes: Exit and landing wind conditions differ. It is highly recommended to have someone at the landing site to relay landing area wind conditions. BASE Jumping is prohibited in this area during certain seasons of the year. Please, check current regulations before jumping.

openedBy.name: Enrique Pastor, Richi Navarro, Hubert, Albrecht and Martin

details.access: Head towards the Herbolari climbing area, until you find a path that borders the wall below the jump and takes you towards Grau de la Tallada all the way up to the exit along the same path.
details.notes: There are two small rock bridges at the exit point, where you can attach a static line if no one is available for pilot chute assist. 10 meters of rope is sufficient.

details.access: Walk towards the Siurana castle ruins, about 2 minutes from the parking. The exit is behind the largest wall at the very foot of the castle, there is a small rock outcropping barely enough room for two feet for a good launch.
details.notes: Mythical jump regarding the legend of the “Reina Mora” (Moorish Queen). Slightly overhung. Static line or PCA jump recommended. You will need anchoring gear for the person who will be PCAing or assisting, the exit platform is not very accommodating.

openedBy.name: David Guti, Luís Manzaneda, Turko Ortiz and David Fusté

details.access: This track may not be the best path to the exit. It even can be a dangerous one leading you to the exit point. It is highly probable that this track was recorded the very day of the opening of the jump, and so, the base jumper who opened the jump probably had to improvise a new path far from being the best one.
details.notes: Sketchy exit point. It was not measured. High enough to jump static, maybe hand held doable.

details.access: From the car 1 minute walking to the right side of the viewpoint, the exit is very evident due to its springboard shape.
details.notes: Precision landing on the train track, caution in the sections where there is a precipitate on the sides of the track. It is recommended to wear a front for the return. (tunnel of more than 500 meters). Check train schedules, there is a lot of margin between one and the other but it is better to make sure to avoid scares. Thank Cristina, Marta Maci and Oreig for their help in previous opening attempts.

openedBy.name: Richi Navarro, Javi Centeno and Nacho Cifuentes

details.access: Fairhead Cliff car park

details.notes: Only accessible at low tide. To get out, hike up the steep grassy slope
details.access: Bunglass Viewpoint. Follow the tourist path up to the exit
details.anchor: Bring a 4ft stake soft sandy soil.

details.notes: park at the Lane to the north of the exit point. Land at Small shingle area at the base of the cliff. Most of the remaining area is big rocks. To  get out, hike up the grassy slope, following the sheep path
details.access: Follow the tourist path up to the exit

details.notes: Exact exit point unknown.
details.access: Coomarkane Visitor Centre. Follow the path up past the old hill village and continue up towards cliff edge

details.notes: re-lasered at ~200ft in 2021 and freefalled by Greg Mc.
details.access: Mahon Falls car park, Hike up the hill beside the car park and follow the ridge towards the waterfall. The exit is a few metres down off the path on a ledge.
details.anchor: big rock, approx. 12 m back from the exit. Bring a rope or a PCA pal, or handheld

details.notes: Loose crumbling rock edge, be aware of sunbathers below. Landing area much bigger at low tide
details.access: Ballydowane beach car park, From the car park, walk back up the road, turn right and then go through the 2nd field on the right towards the cliff edge
details.anchor: Concrete fence post approx. 12m back from edge

details.access: No cars on the island. Take a ferry and then bike / hike, follow tourist signs to Dun Aengus. Exit is to the west of the fort.

details.notes: the exit is not on Eagles rock, it faces it.
details.access: from the car park, hike up the farm track to the South West. Follow the steep sheep path up the hill and traverse South East across towards eagles rock. The exit is down a steep slope and faces eagles rock
details.anchor: Bring a 4ft stake and ~10 m of rope.

details.access: follow the windy road up to the top. Climb over the turnstile and follow the cliff edge up and to the West. 3 metal stakes in the ground mark the exit area.

locations.name: Glencar, Co. Leitrim Lower corner running exit

details.access: Park Beside Glencar Lough follow the windy road up to the top. Climb over the turnstile and follow the cliff edge up and to the West. The running exit faces towards the classic exit

locations.name: Glencar, Co. Leitrim Rock pillar exit

details.access: follow the windy road up to the top. Climb over the turnstile and follow the cliff edge up and to the West. Continue around past the classic exit and the rock pillar is on the corner, a few meters down to the left.
get dropped off on the mountain road east of the cliff. Hike up to the West towards the summit. The cliff is pretty obvious on the right.

details.notes: Parking at Lukes Bridge
details.access: from the car park, Hike up through the bog and up the gulley. Hike along the top of Benbulben towards the summit and continue to the edge. The exit is on the 3rd finger
from the car park, hike up the road to the east. Continue up through the bog. Continue up along the fence line towards the summit. The exit is at the N.E end of the ridge.

locations.name: Benwisken , Co. Sligo Lower, South West exit

details.notes: Park at the Forestry car park east of benwisken
details.access: Approach through forest road to trail head and hike up east face to ridge. Hike south 20 minutes, exit is to the west. (Can view exit from cliff to south). Exit is a rock outcrop. Take caution with footing as gaps.
details.anchor: Bring your own stake, or Freefall

locations.name: Croghaun Cliffs, Co. Mayo Achill Island.

details.notes: Sea Landing, boat pick up required, This is the first known BASE jump in Ireland. The wind on Achill Island is regularly howling. Andy’s 1982 jump is the only known jump from this cliff
details.access: Get dropped off at the end of the track near the deserted village at Slievemore .
Park at the Hunter Canyon/Spring Canyon parking. You can shuttle and leave a car at the Ice Cream Parlor parking but the walk back from the LZ is barely 10min.
Park at the Hunter Canyon/Spring Canyon parking. You can shuttle and leave a car at the Ice Cream Parlor parking but the walk back from the LZ is barely 10min.

details.notes: Please do not land on the road unless you have an emergency. Try to land in a pullout or in the dirst on the side of the road. There is fixed ropes on the way up, hand over hand. No gear required.
details.access: Park at the Hunter Canyon/Spring Canyon parking. You can shuttle and leave a car at the Ice Cream Parlor parking but the walk back from the LZ is barely 10min.

details.notes: Please do not land on the road unless you have an emergency. Try to land in a pullout or in the dirt on the side of the road. There is fixed ropes on the way up, hand over hand. No gear required.
details.access: Park at the Hunter Canyon/Spring Canyon parking. You can shuttle and leave a car at the Ice Cream Parlor parking but the walk back from the LZ is barely 10min

details.notes: Please do not land on the road unless you have an emergency. Land in the clearing.
details.access: Park the Take Out Beach parking.
Park at the Colorado riverside Recreation are parking.

details.notes: JIMS stands for Jimmy Is a Massive Skank as Nolan was upset he couldn’t jump it yet as he was just starting his jumping journey.
details.access: Leave a car at the pullout at the start of the hike and hitchhike back to it or shuttle.

details.notes: There is ropes on the way up, hand over hand. No gear required.
details.access: Park at the Grandstaff trail parking.
Park at the Little Canyon pullout.

details.notes: Lots of good places to land. As per usual, please avoid the road.
1 hour drive from LZ, 2 minutes hike to exit.
details.access: Need to call in to security the day before with jumpers' names. Need to carry ID for security to check. Rock drop: a real drop (like if you slip and fall) 2.5 seconds. Gentle throw (like a lazy push) 6 seconds. Good throw (like a big push) 8 seconds.

details.notes: 1:15 hour drive, 45 minutes hike. We drive through a security gate, to go through the gate, you need to call in the day before with car reg and driver name. You can hike from this security gate, it adds 45 minutes hike.

1:15 hour drive, one-minute hike. We drive through a security gate, to go through the gate, you need to call in the day before with car reg and driver name. You can hike from this security gate, it adds 45 minutes hike. Long distance to LZ, recommend big wingsuits only.

1:15 hour drive, 15-minute hike. We drive through a security gate, to go through the gate, you need to call in the day before with car reg and driver name. You can hike from this security gate, it adds 45 minutes hike.
4-hour hike
4-hour hike
2:30 hour hike

details.access: 2hrs 30 minute hike

details.notes: 45 minutes past Ripper
primary LZ is school, Alternates are beach and wood clearing
